label: PSB VDL START TIME
name: PSB VDL START TIME
display_text: Default hours prior to NOW for the VDL
value_term: HOURS PRIOR TO NOW FOR VDL
value_help: Enter the number of hours prior to NOW that the VDL will initially display
description: Default number of hours prior to NOW that the VDL will display when initially displayed.

label: LA KDIFF DISPLAY UPDATE
name: LA KDIFF DISPLAY UPDATE
description: Select whether the keyboard display updates after each key press.

label: ORWDQ IV RX
name: ORWDQ IV RX
value_help: Select an IV Fluid quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this IV Fluid quick order.
description: Contains the list of common IV Fluid orders for display at the top of theIV Fluids listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORWOR BROADCAST MESSAGES
name: ORWOR BROADCAST MESSAGES
display_text: Broadcast Window Messages to Other Apps
value_help: Enter 'yes' to allow CPRS to notify other applications via windows messages.
description: This parameter may be used to disable the use of windows messaging tonotify other applications of CPRS events.  Normally, this parameter shouldbe set to 'Yes'.  If other applications do not respond appropriately tobroadcast messages, this parameter may be set to 'No' to debug theseapplications.

label: ORWOR AUTO CLOSE PT MSG
name: ORWOR AUTO CLOSE PT MSG
value_help: Enter the number of seconds that the patient message display should remain open.
description: This parameter controls how long the patient messages window displaysbefore automatically closing.  The default is 5.  If the number of secondsis set to 0, the window will remain open until the user clicks it closed.

label: ORWDX NEW MED
name: ORWDX NEW MED
value_help: Enter the entry from the dialog file that should be used for a new med order.
instance_help: Enter the status of patient to which this dialog should apply.
description: This parameter is used to present the order dialog for a New Medicationon the Meds tab of the CPRS GUI. A separate order dialog can be usedfor inpatients and outpatients.

label: ORWDXM ORDER MENU STYLE
name: ORWDXM ORDER MENU STYLE
value_help: Select the style of ordering menu to be used with the GUI.
description: Determines whether GUI order menus include mnemonics.

label: ORWDX NEW CONSULT
name: ORWDX NEW CONSULT
value_help: Enter the entry from the dialog file that should be used for new consults
description: This parameter is used to define the default menu, dialog, or quick orderthat should appear when the user selects New Consult from the consultstab.

label: ORWDQ O RX
name: ORWDQ O RX
value_help: Select an outpatient medication quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this medication.
description: Contains the list of common outpatient meds for display at the top of theMeds listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORXP TEST SINGLE PARAM
name: ORXP TEST SINGLE PARAM
value_help: Enter a number between 1 and 100 (inclusive).
description: This is a test of a parameter allowing 1 instance per entity.

label: ORXP TEST PARAM MULTIPLE
name: ORXP TEST PARAM MULTIPLE
value_help: Enter some free text
instance_help: Enter a number between 1 and 3 (maximum 3 instances).
description: This is a test of a parameter that allows multiple instances.

label: LR IGNORE HOLIDAYS
name: LR IGNORE HOLIDAYS
value_help: Enter 'Yes' if full lab service operates on federal holidays.
description: This indicates if this institution operates at full service duringfederal holidays.

label: LR MAX DAYS CONTINUOUS
name: LR MAX DAYS CONTINUOUS
value_help: Enter the maximum number of days that multiple-continuous orders can be placed.
description: This is the maximum number of days that multiple-continuous orders may beplaced.  The number may be specific to each hospital location.

label: LR PHLEBOTOMY COLLECTION
name: LR PHLEBOTOMY COLLECTION
value_help: Enter the collection time in military format (e.g. 0630).
instance_help: Enter the $H time for this collection.
description: This is the time for each phlebotomy collection.  The instance valuemakes each phlebotomy collection entry unique by using the $H value ofthe collection time.

label: OR OREMAS MED ORDERS
name: OR OREMAS MED ORDERS
display_text: Allow Clerks to act on Med Orders
value_term: ALLOW CLERKS TO ACT ON MED ORDERS
value_help: Enter 1 to allow clerks to enter med orders only or 2 to permit release as well
description: This parameter determines if clerks (i.e. users holding the OREMAS key)are allowed to act on medication orders. If set to YES, a clerk may enternew medication orders or DC these medication orders. Inpatient orders maybe released to the Pharmacy as 'Signed on Chart'. Outpatient orders willrequire the physician's signature. If set to UNRELEASED ONLY, a clerk mayonly enter unreleased orders for both Inpatient and Outpatient. If set toNO, a clerk is completely prohibited from handling medication orders.

label: RA REQUIRE DETAILED
name: RA REQUIRE DETAILED
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to prevent 'Broad' procedures from being ordered.
description: DESCRIPTION:   This Radiology/Nuclear Medicine parameter controls whetherrestrictions are placed on imaging procedures orderable based on proceduretype (possible procedure types are: Detailed, Series, Parent, Broad). If this parameter is set to '0', users are allowed to order any imagingprocedure regardless of type. If set to '1', users are not allowed toselect 'Broad' type imaging procedures.  This parameter may be setdifferently for each division within a multi-divisional facility.

label: RA SUBMIT PROMPT
name: RA SUBMIT PROMPT
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to cause the 'SUBMIT REQUEST TO' prompt to appear.
description: DESCRIPTION:   This is a Radiology/Nuclear Medicine division parametercontrolling whether the ordering clinician is prompted for an ImagingLocation via the 'SUBMIT REQUEST TO' prompt  (1 = user should be prompted,0 = user should not be prompted).  The Imaging Location entered determineswhere the Imaging Request form will print (IRM can assign each ImagingLocation in the Radiology/Nuclear Medicine package a request printer).  Ifthis parameter is set to 0, the Imaging Request form will not be printed.If this parameter is set to 1, the system will first attempt toautomatically determine the Imaging Location, then prompt the user if theautomatic attempt fails. If there is more than one Imaging Location for the current imaging type(examples of imaging types selectable when ordering imaging procedures areNuclear Med, Ultrasound, General Radiology, etc.) the automatic attemptwill fail and the prompt will appear. If there is only one possibleImaging Location for the current imaging type, the system willautomatically default to that location. This parameter may be setdifferently for each division within a multi-divisional facility.

label: ORWDQ UD RX
name: ORWDQ UD RX
value_help: Select an inpatient medication quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this medication.
description: Contains the list of common inpatient meds for display at the top of theMeds listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORWDQ XRAY
name: ORWDQ XRAY
value_help: Select an imaging quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this imaging order.
description: Contains the list of common imaging orders for display at the top of theprocedures listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORWDQ DO
name: ORWDQ DO
value_help: Select an diet quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this lab order.
description: Contains the list of common diet orders for display at the top of the DietComponents listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORWDQ TF
name: ORWDQ TF
value_help: Select a tubefeeding quick order.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for this tubefeeding order.
description: Contains the list of common tubefeedingdiet orders for display at the topof the Tubefeeding Products listbox in the GUI ordering dialog.

label: ORWDX WRITE ORDERS LIST
name: ORWDX WRITE ORDERS LIST
value_help: Enter an ORDER DIALOG menu that will be used for the Write Orders listbox.
description: This parameter is used to identify a menu in the ORDER DIALOG file thatwill be used as the list of items that may be selected in the Write Orderslistbox of the CPRS GUI.

label: ORWOR TIMEOUT COUNTDOWN
name: ORWOR TIMEOUT COUNTDOWN
value_help: Enter the number of seconds for the countdown before closing the chart.
description: This value is the number of seconds used for the countdown when thetimeout notification window appears.

label: PSB VDL INCL ON-CALL
name: PSB VDL INCL ON-CALL
value_term: INCLUDE ON CALL MEDS ON DUE LIST
value_help: Enter 'Y' to have On-Call Meds included in the initial VDL
description: Determines wether initial Due List View contains On Callmedications.

label: ORWDP WINPRINT DEFAULT
name: ORWDP WINPRINT DEFAULT
value_help: Set to YES to use Windows printer as default.
description: If set to YES, CPRS GUI will display Windows standard printer selectiondialog instead of the VistA printer selection dialog. If set to NO, the standard VistA printer selection dialog will bedisplayed, still allowing selection of a Windows printer, but requiring anadditional prompt.

label: ORWRP CIRN REMOTE DATA ALLOW
name: ORWRP CIRN REMOTE DATA ALLOW
value_help: Enter YES to allow access to remote patient data.
description: This parameter determines who is allowed access to patient data atremote sites.  The values for this parameter can be controlled down to theUSER entity.

label: LR LAB COLLECT FUTURE
name: LR LAB COLLECT FUTURE
display_text: Lab Collect Days Allowed in Future
value_term: LAB COLLECT DAYS ALLOWED IN FUTURE
value_help: Enter the number of days allowed to collect 'Lab Collect' future orders.
description: This is the maximum number of days that 'Lab Collect' orders may beplaced.  The number may be specific to each hospital location.

label: ORWDPS SUPPRESS DISPENSE MSG
name: ORWDPS SUPPRESS DISPENSE MSG
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to suppress display of the dispense drug message.

label: ORWDQ QUICK VIEW
name: ORWDQ QUICK VIEW
value_help: Enter the name of an entry in the ORDER QUICK VIEW file.
instance_help: Select the display group to which this quick view belongs.
description: This parameter contains the name of a personal quick order list for aspecific display group.

label: ORWOR ENABLE VERIFY
name: ORWOR ENABLE VERIFY
value_domain: 0:Enable Verify Actions if Ordering Enabled;1:Enable Verify Actions Always;2:Disable Verify Actions
value_help: Select when the order verification actions should be active.
description: This parameter controls whether nurses are allowed to verify orders in theGUI.  The default value is 0, which allows nurses to verify orders onlywhen ordering is enabled.  To allow nurses to verify orders when orderingis disabled, set the value to 1.  To never allow the verify actions, setthe value to 2. This parameter applies to the "Verify" and "Chart Review" on the Actionsmenu on the Order tab.

label: PSB ROBOT RX
name: PSB ROBOT RX
description: Parameter should be "yes" if site is using the robot RX.

label: ORWOR DISABLE HOLD ORDERS
name: ORWOR DISABLE HOLD ORDERS
value_help: Enter yes if using the Hold/Unhold actions should be disallowed in GUI.
description: This parameter will prevent orders from being placed on hold.

label: TIU TEMPLATE USER AUTO DELETE
name: TIU TEMPLATE USER AUTO DELETE
value_help: Enter Y or N; Y turns auto-template cleanup on.
description: This parameter is queried by code which activates upon termination of auser.  It the parameter is set to 'Y' then whenever a user is terminated,his/her non-shared TIU templates will be deleted.  The default setting is'N.'

label: ORB ARCHIVE PERIOD
name: ORB ARCHIVE PERIOD
value_help: Enter the number of days to archive this notification before deletion.
instance_help: Enter the notification related to this archive period.
description: The number of days to archive a notification for a site.  If notindicated, the default period of 30 days is used.  The maximum number ofdays is 100,000 or about 220 years.  This value is passed to the KernelAlert Utility where the actual archiving and deletion ofalerts/notifications occurs.

label: ORB DELETE MECHANISM
name: ORB DELETE MECHANISM
value_help: Enter 'I' if deleted on individual review/action; 'A' for all recipients.
instance_help: Enter the notification related to the deletion.
description: Set of codes used to determine how a notification will be deleted at asite.  Codes include: I (Individual Recipient): delete the notificationfor  an individual recipient when a) that individual completes thefollow-up  action on notifications with associated follow-up action,  b)that  individual reviews notifications without follow-up actions.  A (AllRecipients): delete the notification for all recipients when a) anyrecipient completes the follow-up action on notifications with follow-upactions,  b) any recipient reviews notifications without follow-upactions.

label: ORB FORWARD SUPERVISOR
name: ORB FORWARD SUPERVISOR
display_text: Hold Days before Forward to Supervisor
value_help: The number of days to hold notif. before forwarding to recipient's supervisor.
instance_help: The notification related to this forwarding period.
description: The number of days before a notification is forwarded to a recipient'ssupervisor.  The maximum is 30 days.  If not indicated or zero, thenotification will not be forwarded.  For example, if a notification has avalue of 14 for this parameter, it will be forwarded to the supervisor ofeach recipient who hasn't processed the notification after 14 days.Determination of recipients who have not processed the notification andwho  their supervisors are is made by the Kernel Alert Utility.  It willnot be  forwarded to supervisors of recipients who have processed thealert within  14 days.  If the value of this parameter is zero ornon-existent, the  alert/notification will never be forwarded.For this purpose, the supervisor is identified as the recipient's service/section chief.

label: ORB FORWARD SURROGATES
name: ORB FORWARD SURROGATES
display_text: Hold Days before Forward to Surrogates
value_help: Number of days to hold notif. before forwarding to recipient's surrogates.
instance_help: The notification related to this forwarding period.
description: The number of days before a notification is forwarded to a recipient'ssurrogates.  The maximum is 30 days.  If not indicated or zero, thenotification will not be forwarded.  For example, if a notification has avalue of 14 for this parameter, it will be forwarded to the surrogates ofeach recipient who haven't processed the notification after 14 days.Determination of recipients who have not processed the notification andwho  their surrogates are is made by the Kernel Alert Utility.  It willnot be  forwarded to surrogates of recipients who have processed the alertwithin 14  days.  If the value of this parameter is zero or non-existent,the  alert/notification will never be forwarded. For this purpose, thesurrogate(s) are identified as the recipient's MailMan surrogate(s).

label: ORB OI ORDERED - INPT
name: ORB OI ORDERED - INPT
display_text: Flag Items to Send INPT ORDER Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is ordered for an inpatient. If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alertrecipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potentialalert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a deviceis added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive thealert.) Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attendingphysician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner,PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient'sPCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient.OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (If apatient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users on thatteam become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.) arelinked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RR team.

label: ORB OI RESULTS - INPT
name: ORB OI RESULTS - INPT
display_text: Flag Item to Send INPT RESULT Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification when resulted.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is resulted for an inpatient.  Results only apply to orderswhich can be resulted (lab, imaging, consults.) If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alertrecipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potentialalert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a deviceis added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive thealert.) Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attendingphysician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner,PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient'sPCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient.OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (Ifa patient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users onthat team become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.)are linked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RRteam.

label: ORB PROCESSING FLAG
name: ORB PROCESSING FLAG
value_help: Code indicating processing flag for the entity and notification.
instance_help: Notification related to the processing flag.
description: Flag used to determine if a notification should be delivered to a user/recipient. Valid values include Mandatory, Enabled or Disabled.

label: ORQQLR DATE RANGE OUTPT
name: ORQQLR DATE RANGE OUTPT
display_text: Outpatient Lab Number of Days to Display
value_term: Outpatient Lab Number of Days to Display
value_help: Enter the number of days to search back in time for lab orders/results.
description: The number of days backwards in time to search for lab orders/results.  If not indicated, the default period of 30 days will be used.  Themaximum number of days is 100,000 or about 220 years. For outpatients.

label: ORB PROVIDER RECIPIENTS
name: ORB PROVIDER RECIPIENTS
value_help: Any one or combination of 'P', 'A', 'T' 'O', 'M', 'E', 'R', 'S' and/or 'C'.
instance_help: Notification sent to the patient's provider recipients.
description: Set of codes indicating default provider recipients of a notification by their title or relationship to the patient.  Notifications can be set up with any or all of the following codes:   P (Primary Provider): deliver notification to  the patient's PrimaryProvider.    A (Attending Physician): deliver notification to the patient's AttendingPhysician.  T (Patient Care Teams): deliver notification to the patient's OE/RR Teams (personal patient and team lists are evaluated for potential recipients) and to devices on an OE/RR team.  O (Ordering Provider): deliver notification to the providerwho placed the order which trigger the notification.  M (PCMM Team): deliver notification to users/providers linked to thepatient via PCMM Team Position assignments.  E (Entering User): deliver notification to the user/provider who enteredthe order's most recent activity.  R (PCMM Primary Care Practitioner): deliver notification to thepatient's PCMM Primary Care Practitioner.  S (PCMM Associate Provider): deliver notification to the patient's PCMMAssociate Provider.  C (PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator): deliver notification to the patient's PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator. The providers, physicians and teams must be set up properly and accuratelyfor the correct individuals to receive the notification.

label: ORB URGENCY
name: ORB URGENCY
value_help: Urgency for the notification as 1:High, 2:Moderate, or 3:Low.
instance_help: Notification related to the urgency.
description: Set of codes indicating the urgency for a notification for a site.  Theurgency is mainly used for sorting in displays.  The codes include: 1(High): notification is Highly urgent.  2 (Moderate): notification isModerately urgent.  3 (Low): notification is of Low urgency.

label: ORQQLR SEARCH RANGE OUTPT
name: ORQQLR SEARCH RANGE OUTPT
value_help: Enter the number of days to search back in time for lab orders/results.
description: The number of days backwards in time to search for lab orders/results.  If not indicated, the default period of 30 days will be used.  Themaximum number of days is 100,000 or about 220 years. For outpatients.

label: ORQQRA SEARCH RANGE
name: ORQQRA SEARCH RANGE
value_term: Radiology Exam Number of Display Days
value_help: Enter the number of days to search back in time for radiology exams.
description: The number of days backwards in time to search for radiology/nuclearmedicine exams/reports.  If not indicated, the default period of 730 days(2 years) will be used.  The maximum number of days is 100,000 or about220 years.

label: ORWUH WHATSTHIS
name: ORWUH WHATSTHIS
value_help: Enter the title for the help window.
instance_help: Enter the form name and control name in the format: Form.Control
description: PostingsThis button provides access to patient postings.  The single letterabbreviation for each type of posting appears on the button, if such aposting exists.

label: ORLP DEFAULT LIST SOURCE
name: ORLP DEFAULT LIST SOURCE
value_domain: T:Team/Personal List;W:Ward List;C:Clinic List;P:Provider List;S:Specialty List;M:Combination List
value_help: Any one of 'T', 'W', 'C', 'P', 'S', or 'M'.
description: Default preference for patient list source.  Valid values include:  T:Team/Personal ListW:Ward ListC:Clinic ListP:Provider ListS:Specialty ListM:Combination List

label: ORLP DEFAULT LIST ORDER
name: ORLP DEFAULT LIST ORDER
value_help: Any one of 'A', 'R', 'P', 'T', or 'S'.
description: Default sort order for the patient list.  Room/Bed is valid only for inpatients list (Ward, Team/Personal Team, Provider, Specialty). Appointment Date is valid only for outpatient lists (Clinic) andCombination lists.  Source is valid only for Combination lists.

label: ORLP DEFAULT WARD
name: ORLP DEFAULT WARD
value_help: Ward to be default source of patient.
description: Ward for default list of patients.

label: ORLP DEFAULT TEAM
name: ORLP DEFAULT TEAM
value_help: Team/Personal list to be default source of patients.
description: Team/Personal list to be default source of patients.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC MONDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC MONDAY
value_help: Clinic to be default patient list source on Monday.
description: Clinic identified as a default source for patients on Monday.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC START DATE
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC START DATE
value_help: Add patients to Clinic List with appointments as early as this date.
description: Patients with appointment dates as early as this date will be added to theClinic List.  Patients will be added with appointment dates between STARTDATE and STOP DATE.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC STOP DATE
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC STOP DATE
value_help: Add patients to Clinic List with appointments as recent as this date.
description: Patients with appointment dates as recent as this date will be added to theClinic List.  Patients will be added with appointment dates between STARTDATE and STOP DATE.

label: ORLP DEFAULT PROVIDER
name: ORLP DEFAULT PROVIDER
value_help: Provider who is a source for patient list.
description: Provider who is basis for building the Provider List of patients.

label: ORLP DEFAULT SPECIALTY
name: ORLP DEFAULT SPECIALTY
value_help: Treating Specialty as a patient source.
description: Treating Specialty used as a source for patients on the Specialty List.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC TUESDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC TUESDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be default for creating Tuesday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default for determining patient list on Tuesdays.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC WEDNESDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC WEDNESDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be source of Wednesday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default source of Wednesday's patient list.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC THURSDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC THURSDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be source of Thursday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default source of Thursday's patient list.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC FRIDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC FRIDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be source of Friday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default source of Friday's patient list.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC SATURDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC SATURDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be source of Saturday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default source of Saturday's patient list.

label: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC SUNDAY
name: ORLP DEFAULT CLINIC SUNDAY
value_help: Enter clinic to be source of Sunday's patient list.
description: Clinic to be default source of Sunday's patient list.

label: ORQQAP SEARCH RANGE START
name: ORQQAP SEARCH RANGE START
value_help: List appointments for a patient as early as this date in format 'T', 'T-30'.
description: Returns the relative date to begin listing appointments for a patientacross all clinics. For example, T-30 will begin listing appointments atclinics beginning 30 days before now,  T will list appointments begin-ning today.

label: ORQQAP SEARCH RANGE STOP
name: ORQQAP SEARCH RANGE STOP
value_help: List appointments for a patient as late as this date in format 'T', 'T+7'.
description: Returns the relative date to end listing appointments for a patient atall clinics.  For example, 'T+30' will not list appointments at theclinics after 30 days from now. 'T' will not list appointments later thantoday.

label: ORQQVS SEARCH RANGE START
name: ORQQVS SEARCH RANGE START
value_help: Enter relative start date to list visits.  (E.g. T-120)
description: Returns the relative date to start listing visits for a patient.For example, 'T-90' will list visits beginning 90 days before today.

label: ORQQVS SEARCH RANGE STOP
name: ORQQVS SEARCH RANGE STOP
value_help: Enter the relative stop date to list visits.  (E.g., T, T+30)
description: Returns the relative date to end listing visits for a patient.For example, 'T' will not list visits later than today.  'T+30' will notlist visits after 30 days from now.

label: LR COLLECT FRIDAY
name: LR COLLECT FRIDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT THURSDAY
name: LR COLLECT THURSDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT WEDNESDAY
name: LR COLLECT WEDNESDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT TUESDAY
name: LR COLLECT TUESDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT MONDAY
name: LR COLLECT MONDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT SUNDAY
name: LR COLLECT SUNDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: LR COLLECT SATURDAY
name: LR COLLECT SATURDAY
value_help: Enter 1 if routine collection is done on this day
description: This determines if routine collection is done on this day.

label: ORWOR CATEGORY SEQUENCE
name: ORWOR CATEGORY SEQUENCE
value_help: Enter the display group of orders to be listed at this sequence.
instance_help: Enter a number representing the sequence for this display group.
description: Multiple instances of this parameter combine to form a list of the displaygroups shown in the order review screen.  Orders are displayed by thesequence identified in this list.

label: ORQQCN SEARCH RANGE
name: ORQQCN SEARCH RANGE
value_help: Enter the number of days to search back in time for consults/requests.
description: The number of days in time to search backwards for consults/requests.  Ifnot indicated, the default period of 730 days (2 years) will be used.  Themaximum number of days is 100,000 or about 220 years.

label: ORB SORT METHOD
name: ORB SORT METHOD
value_help: P:Patient, M:Message, U:Urgency, I:Info, L:Location, D:Date, F:Fwd By.
description: Method for sorting notifications when displayed in the CPRS GUI. Methodsinclude: by Patient, Message (text), Urgency, Info, Location, Date/Time,and Forwarded By/When.

label: OR ORDER REVIEW DT
name: OR ORDER REVIEW DT
display_text: Last Date/Time User Review Pt Orders
value_help: Enter the date/time the user reviewed this patient's orders.
instance_help: Enter the patient whose orders were reviewed.
description: Date/time this user last review the patient's orders.

label: ORK CLINICAL DANGER LEVEL
name: ORK CLINICAL DANGER LEVEL
value_help: Enter the code indicating the clinical danger level of the order check.
description: Package, System, Division indicate the clinical danger level of an ordercheck.  Valid levels include High, Moderate, Low.  The clinical danger level is used in sorting for order check display and prompting for override.

label: ORK PROCESSING FLAG
name: ORK PROCESSING FLAG
value_help: Code indicating the processing flag for the entity and order check.
instance_help: Order check related to the processing flag.
description: Flag indicating if an order check should be processed for a certain set ofcircumstances.  An order check can be Enabled or Disabled.  Only Enabledorder checks will be processed.

label: ORQQCN DATE RANGE
name: ORQQCN DATE RANGE
value_help: Enter the number of days to search back in time for consults/requests.
description: The number of days in time to search backwards for consults/requests.  Ifnot indicated, the default period of 730 days (2 years) will be used.  Themaximum number of days is 100,000 or about 220 years.

label: ORB FLAGGED ORDERS BULLETIN
name: ORB FLAGGED ORDERS BULLETIN
value_help: Enter 'yes' to send a bulletin when an order is flagged for clarification.
description: 'Yes' indicates a MailMan bulletin will be sent to the order's Current Provider (usually the Ordering Provider) when the order is flagged forclarification.  This parameter has no effect on the Flagged Ordersnotification which is also triggered when an order is flagged forclarification.

label: OREVNT MANUAL RELEASE CONTROL
name: OREVNT MANUAL RELEASE CONTROL
value_domain: K:Keys Only (ORES/ORELSE);P:Manual Release Paramater Only (OREVENT MANUAL RELEASE);B:Both (K and P)
value_help: Select how the use of the manual release action should be controlled.
description: This parameter defines how access to the manual release action is controlled.  There are three possible settings: 1: Keys Only - In this setting only holders of the ORES and ORELSE key may manually release a delayed order.  This is how the system previously controlled access to this action.  If the OREVNT MANUAL RELEASE CONTROL parameter is not set then this will be the default setting. 2: Manual Release Parameter Only - In this setting the OREVNT MANUAL RELEASE parameter controls who is allowed to manually release a delayed  order.  The OREVNT MANUAL RELEASE parameter is distributed with no settings, which effectively denies access to manual release if the control parameter is set to P. In order to have the OREVNT MANUAL RELEASEparameter control access to the manual release action you must set somelevel of the parameter to a positive (YES) value. 3: Both Keys and Parameter - In this setting a check is first made to see if the user has either the ORES or ORELSE key.  If they do not then a check is made to see if the user will have access through the parameter settings.  In this setting, if the user does not hold either the ORES or ORELSE key they could still have access to the action based on your parameter settings, which may be more liberal than you'd like.  Be sure to check your settings.

label: ORPF PROMPT FOR WORK COPY
name: ORPF PROMPT FOR WORK COPY
value_domain: 0:DON'T PROMPT;1:PROMPT AND ASK DEVICE;2:PROMPT AND NOT ASK DEVICE;*:DON'T PRINT
value_help: Specify the prompting logic for work copies
description: This field allows various levels of user interaction for printing awork copy of the orders.    ENTER 0 for no prompts- work copy is automatically generated.        1 to prompt for work copy and ask which printer should be used.        2 to prompt for work copy and automatically print to the          printer defined in the WORK COPY PRINT DEVICE field.        * don't print.

label: ORB SYSTEM ENABLE_DISABLE
name: ORB SYSTEM ENABLE/DISABLE
value_help: Enter 'Enable/E' for notifications, 'Disable/D' to stop notifications.
description: Parameter determines if any notification processing will occur.  'E' or'Enable' indicates the notifications system is enabled and running.  'D'or 'Disabled' indicates the notifications system is disabled and notrunning.  Can be set at the Institution, System or Package level.

label: OREVNT EXCLUDE DGRP
name: OREVNT EXCLUDE DGRP
display_text: Excluded groups for copy active order
value_help: enter display group
description: If the "copy active orders" field of a release event is set to YES then any orders that belong to the display groups listed in this parameter will NOT be presented in the list of orders to copy.  This parameter allows you to screen certain types of orders from being copied when writing delayed orders.

label: ORK DEBUG ENABLE_DISABLE
name: ORK DEBUG ENABLE/DISABLE
value_help: Enter 'Enable/E' to log debug messages.
description: Parameter determines if order checking will log debug messages into^XTMP("ORKLOG".  'Enabled' indicates logging will occur.  'Disabled' willprevent logging of messages and delete log file (^XTMP("ORKLOG")). The data for zero node entries is the information passed to order checkingfrom OE/RR. The zero node is in the format:^XTMP("ORKLOG",<order check date/time>,<pt id>,<orderable item>,<dlog mode>,<user id>,0)=<orderable item>|<filler>|<natl id^natl text^natl sys^local id^local text^local sys>|<order effective date/time>|<order number>|<filler data> The data for non-zero node entries is the information passed from orderchecking back to OE/RR.  It is the order check messages plus other info toenhance OE/RR processing.  It is in the format:^XTMP("ORKLOG",<order check date/time>,<pt id>,<orderable item>,<dlog mode>,<user id>,<non-zero>)=<order number>^<order check id - 864.5 ien>^<clin danger level>^<message>

label: ORWOR PKI SITE
name: ORWOR PKI SITE

description: Answer YES to this field to prompt with urgency for every test whenordering through OE/RR.  Tests with a forced urgency as defined in theLaboratory test file overide this parameter.

label: LR DEFAULT TYPE QUICK
name: LR DEFAULT TYPE QUICK

description: The entry in this field will determine the type of collection that 'QuickOrders' will have assigned to them.ex: Ward Collect (WC), Send Patient (SP) or Lab Collect (LC)

label: PSB GUI DEFAULT PRINTER

description: This parameter controls if a user when exiting XUP is dropped into VPE orright to the ">" prompt.

label: ORWT TOOLS MENU
name: ORWT TOOLS MENU
value_help: Example:  Notepad=C:\WINDOWS\NOTEPAD.EXE
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which this menu item should appear.
description: This parameter may be used to identify which items should appear on thetools menu which is displayed by the CPRS GUI.  Each item should containa name that should be displayed on the menu, followed by an equal sign,followed by the command string used to invoke the executable.  Thisstring may also include parameters that are passed to the executable.Some example entries are:      Hospital Policy=C:\WINNT\SYSTEM32\VIEWERS\QUIKVIEW.EXE LOCPLCY.DOC     VISTA Terminal=C:\PROGRA~1\KEA\KEAVT.EXE VISTA.KTC An ampersand may be used in the name portion to identify a letter thatshould be underlined on the menu for quick keyboard access.  For example,to underscore the letter H in Hospital Policy, enter &Hospital Policy asthe name part. To use submenus on the tools menu, you must place special text in thecaption and action values.  Submenus must have action text SUBMENU ID,where ID is a unique identifier for the submenu.  Menu items belonging tothe submenu must specify which submenu they belong to by appending [ID]after the caption.  Thus the following entries create a Utilities submenuwith 2 child items:      Utilities=SUBMENU 1     Calculator[1]=calc.exe     Notepad[1]=notepad.exe To create a nested submenu, you create a submenu that belongs to anothersubmenu s ID.  For example, to create a nested submenu belonging theabove Utilities submenu, you would do the following:      Utility Web Sites[1]=SUBMENU UtilWeb     MicroSoft Tools[UtilWeb]=http:\\www.msdn While submenu IDs at the end of a caption are not displayed on the Toolsmenu, this is only true if a corresponding menu ID is found.  If no MenuID is found, the square brackets and included text will appear as part ofthe caption on the Tools menu.  This allows for existing bracketed textto remain displayed. If two submenus share the same menu ID, the second submenu will betreated as belonging to the first menu. One point worth noting.  If you have a caption of a single dash (or asingle dash followed by a submenu id), it will create a separator line inthe menu or submenu.  This is not new functionality, but may not havebeen previously documented. Finally, if more than 30 menu items are assigned to the top level menu(i.e. they are not part of a submenu), a "More..." submenu willautomatically be created at the top of the Tools menu, with additionalmenu items spilling into the newly created "More..." submenu.  If morethan 30 menu items spill into the "More..." submenu, another "More..."submenu will be created inside the first "More..." submenu, withadditional menu items spilling into it, and so on, as needed.  Note,however, that there is a limit of 99 total menu items, since you can onlyenter an integer sequence number from 1-99 when defining the ORWT TOOLSMENU parameter.

If you need to alter the display range for expired medication orders on the Orders tab, please adjust the ORWOR EXPIRED ORDERS parameter accordingly.

label: PSB BKUP ONLINE
name: PSB BKUP ONLINE
description: This parameter is used by the BCMA Backup system to activate the Contingency software. If the value is set to NO then no HL7 messages will be sent to the Workstation. This does not affect the workstation initialization option.

label: PSB BKUP IPH
name: PSB BKUP IPH
description: The BCMA Backup Contingency software uses this parameter. During the Workstation initialization process this tell the process how many days of historic Inpatient Medication Orders to capture. It is based off the fact the order was active during that time.

label: PSB BKUP MEDLG
name: PSB BKUP MEDLG
description: The BCMA Backup Contingency software uses this parameter. During the Workstation initialization process this tell the process how many days of historic Med Log entries of Inpatient Medication Orders to capture.

label: DENTV PAGE SETUP
name: DENTV PAGE SETUP
value_help: Enter the value for this page setup feature
instance_help: Enter the name of the page setup feature
description: This parameter is multi-instance.  The instance value contains the name of the page setup attribute that the DRM GUI is expecting. As of 7/14/2003 - these are the allowable system defaults: Instance                          Value--------------------  -----------------------------------------------TOP MARGIN            0.5LEFT MARGIN           0.25BOTTOM MARGIN         0.5RIGHT MARGIN          0.25FOOTER FONT NAME      Courier NewFOOTER FONT SIZE      10FOOTER FONT STYLE     fsRegular    (fsRegular; fsBold; fsItalic)FOOTER TEXT LINES     0HEADER FONT NAME      Courier NewHEADER FONT SIZE      10HEADER FONT STYLE     fsRegular    (fsRegular; fsBold; fsItalic)HEADER TEXT LINES     5            (Maximum 5 header lines)PAGE FONT NAME        Courier NewPAGE FONT SIZE        10PAGE FONT STYLE       fsRegular    (fsRegular; fsBold; fsItalic)PAGE ORIENT           poPortrait   (poPortrait; poLandscape)PRINT PAGE NUMBER     1            (1=Yes; 0=No)PAGE NUMBER HORZ      pnCenter     (pnLeft; pnCenter; pnRight)PAGE NUMBER VERT      pnBottom     (pnTop; pnBottom)

name: DENTV CVISION
description: This parameter is multi-instance for the purpose of retrieving all the default values for all the CVision parameters. Set of codes type is used instead of the yes/no type as the treatment planning software expects NO=0 and YES=-1. label: DENTV DATE RANGE
name: DENTV DATE RANGE
value_help: For retrieving data, enter # days back or max num
description: This parameter contains the values for the various date range settings within DRM.  The personal preference setup window allows the user to set two values:  Number of days back that data will be retrieved from Today  Maximum number of records to retrieve The instance for this parameter is the name of the packageThe value is the numeric value for those two mentioned above The instance has a format of <package> NUMBER OF DAYS                             <package> MAX  where <package> : = DENT                      LAB                      NOTES                      VISIT

label: DENTV DRM ADMINISTRATOR
name: DENTV DRM ADMINISTRATOR
value_help: Enter yes if this individual has administrator privileges to the DRM package
description: This parameter determines whether or not a user has administrator privileges to the DRM package.

label: DENTV DRM BOILERPLATE PROMPT
name: DENTV DRM BOILERPLATE PROMPT
description: This will control the display of the boilerplate prompt within the DRM GUI

label: DENTV DRM DEF ENC TAB
name: DENTV DRM DEF ENC TAB
value_help: Enter the default tab that should be highlighted on the encounter page
description: This free text field will control the default tab that is displayed when on the encounter page.  The value must be a value entered as a subcategory-1 from file 228.

label: DENTV DRM DEF STARTUP TAB
name: DENTV DRM DEF STARTUP TAB
value_help: Enter the tab that the DRM GUI should open on
description: Enter the major tab that the DRM GUI should open up in when launched.

label: DENTV DRM EXCEL EXTRACT
name: DENTV DRM EXCEL EXTRACT
value_help: Enter YES if this individual can run the DRM Excel extract option.
description: This parameter will control whether or not the user can run the Excel extract option within DRM.

label: DENTV DRM EXTRACT IP
name: DENTV DRM EXTRACT IP
value_help: Enter the IP address where the DRM 'TCP/IP' listener is running.
description: Enter the IP address where the DRM listener is running to receive the Excel extract.  The value should be in the proper syntax to be used in the M open command.

label: DENTV DRM EXTRACT PORT
name: DENTV DRM EXTRACT PORT
value_help: Enter the port number that the 'TCP/IP' listener is listening on.
description: This is the port number that the DRM 'TCP/IP' listener is listening on.

label: DENTV DRM USER CHAR ACCESS
name: DENTV DRM USER CHAR ACCESS
description: The DRM GUI allowed the user to lookup NEW PERSON information similar to the Kernel's Toolbox option.  It also allowed the user to edit certain fields in the NEW PERSON file for their own record.  This parameter will allow the site to configure which of these options are available.

label: DENTV DRM DEF TEMP FOLDER
name: DENTV DRM DEF TEMP FOLDER
value_help: Enter valid Windows path where temporary files may be placed (e.g, c:\temp\)
description: The DRM GUI application has need to occasionally create temporary files.  This parameter stores the location for those temporary files.  The default location is c:\temp\.  The value must be a valid Windows NT path designation.

label: DENTV CPT QUICK LIST
name: DENTV CPT QUICK LIST
value_help: You may sequence the order that your quick list CPT codes will be displayed
description: This contains a quick list of cpt codes for an user.

label: DENTV ICD9 QUICK LIST
name: DENTV ICD9 QUICK LIST
value_help: You sequence the order that the ICD9 codes will be displayed
description: This contains user's quick list of most commonly used diagnosis codes.

label: XHD TEST WP PARAMETERS
name: XHD TEST WP PARAMETERS
description: Test filing of large strings (e.g., XML streams) as parameter values.

label: XHD TEST SCALAR PARAMETER
name: XHD TEST SCALAR PARAMETER
value_help: Specify an integer number between zero and one hundred.
description: This is a test parameter for integration testing of the HealtheVet Desktop Configurator module. It has no use in production applications.

label: XHD PRISM DEFAULT PERSPECTIVE
name: XHD PRISM DEFAULT PERSPECTIVE
value_help: Indicate the Perspective to which the Desktop should open initially
description: This is the perspective to which the HealtheVet Desktop should open by default.

label: XHD PRISM PERSPECTIVE SELECTOR
name: XHD PRISM PERSPECTIVE SELECTOR
value_help: Enter the option that lists the perspectives available in the desktop.
description: This identifies the option that lists the perspectives that are initally shown in the HealtheVet Desktop.

label: XHD PRISM ADA S508 NOTICE
name: XHD PRISM ADA S508 NOTICE
value_help: Indicate whether the user has been shown the Section 508 notice.
description: This parameter is used to store a Boolean flag indicating whether or not the user has been given the opportunity to review the notice with respect to Section 508 of the Americans with Disabilities Act.

label: ORRC NURSE EVENT DATE MAX
name: ORRC NURSE EVENT DATE MAX
value_help: Include events in Dashboard with dates as recent as this date.
description: Events with dates as recent as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Events will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE EVENT DATE MIN
name: ORRC NURSE EVENT DATE MIN
value_help: Include events in Dashboard with dates as early as this date.
description: Events with dates as early as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Events will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC DASHBOARD PT SELECT LIST
name: ORRC DASHBOARD PT SELECT LIST
value_help: This XML fragment describes the sources for the pt. selection list
description: This parameter allows the Dashboard to save lists of Patient Selectionsources.

label: ORRC NURSE RESULT DATE MAX
name: ORRC NURSE RESULT DATE MAX
value_help: Include results in Dashboard with dates as recent as this date.
description: Results with dates as recent as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Results will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE RESULT DATE MIN
name: ORRC NURSE RESULT DATE MIN
value_help: Include results in Dashboard with dates as early as this date.
description: Results with dates as early as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Results will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE UNVERIFIED DATE MAX
name: ORRC NURSE UNVERIFIED DATE MAX
value_help: Include unverified orders in Dashboard with dates as recent as this date.
description: Unverified orders with dates as recent as this date will be added to theDashboard. Orders will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE UNVERIFIED DATE MIN
name: ORRC NURSE UNVERIFIED DATE MIN
value_help: Include unverified orders in Dashboard with dates as early as this date.
description: Unverified orders with dates as early as this date will be added to theDashboard. Orders will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE TEXT ORDER DATE MAX
name: ORRC NURSE TEXT ORDER DATE MAX
value_help: Include text orders in Dashboard with dates as recent as this date.
description: Text orders with dates as recent as this date will be added to theDashboard. Orders will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE TEXT ORDER DATE MIN
name: ORRC NURSE TEXT ORDER DATE MIN
value_help: Include text orders in Dashboard with dates as early as this date.
description: Text orders with dates as early as this date will be added to theDashboard. Orders will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE VITALS DATE MAX
name: ORRC NURSE VITALS DATE MAX
value_help: Include vitals in Dashboard with dates as recent as this date.
description: Vitals with dates as recent as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Vitals will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC NURSE VITALS DATE MIN
name: ORRC NURSE VITALS DATE MIN
value_help: Include vitals in Dashboard with dates as early as this date.
description: Vitals with dates as early as this date will be added to the Dashboard.Vitals will be added with dates between MIN DATE and MAX DATE.

label: ORRC ACTIVATION DATE
name: ORRC ACTIVATION DATE
value_help: Enter the date after which Care Management will be available.
description: This is the date that users are expected to begin using the Care Managementapplication; after this date, results data will be accumulated and trackedin the Order Acknowledgment file #102.4 for designated users.

label: MD USER DEFAULTS
name: MD USER DEFAULTS
description: This parameter is used to store a users default parameter settings.  Each setting is defined on the client.

label: MD CRC VALUES
name: MD CRC VALUES
description: This parameter is used to store the CRC values for the most recentversions of executable and libraries.  Use the Tools menu on the CPManagerprogram to calculate the needed CRC Values of the current versions.

label: MD WEBLINK
name: MD WEBLINK
description: This parameter contains the web address for the Clinical Procedures homepage.  This can be modified to a local address in the event that the pagesare downloaded to be displayed from a local server location.

label: MD DAYS FOR INSTRUMENT DATA
name: MD DAYS FOR INSTRUMENT DATA
description: The number of days to keep data from the auto-instruments afterthe data has been associated with a Clinical Procedures report.

label: MD ONLINE
name: MD ONLINE
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to allow access to CP
description: This parameter controls access to the Clinical Procedures package.

label: MD HFS SCRATCH
name: MD HFS SCRATCH
value_help: Enter in an OS level directory
description: Contains the directory specification for the Kernel OPEN^%ZISH call.  Thisdirectory should be accessible for read/write operations by all CP users.

label: MD VERSION CHK
name: MD VERSION CHK
description: This parameter is used to store the application:versions that are compatiblewith the current server version of Clinical Procedures.  Instance formatof APPLICATION:VERSION  (example: CPMANAGER.EXE:0.0.0.0).

label: MD IMAGING XFER
name: MD IMAGING XFER
description: This parameter contains the name of a network server, share, and path(UNC) to a location where Clinical Procedures can put files for pick-up bythe Imaging background processor for archiving.

label: MD FILE EXTENSIONS
name: MD FILE EXTENSIONS
value_help: Enter a description of this file type
instance_help: Enter the extension of the file type with a '.'
description: This parameter stores a list of valid file types and the associatedextensions of these files.

label: MD CRC BYPASS
name: MD CRC BYPASS
description: Set this value to 'Yes' to prevent the client application from verifyingits CRC Value at startup.

label: MD OFFLINE MESSAGE
name: MD OFFLINE MESSAGE
description: This parameter contains a message to display to the users when the ClinicalProcedures application is offline.

label: MD ALLOW EXTERNAL ATTACHMENTS
name: MD ALLOW EXTERNAL ATTACHMENTS
description: Set this value to Yes to allow users of CPUser.exe to attach documents to the transaction that are not created by an instrument.

label: OR OREMAS NON-VA MED ORDERS
name: OR OREMAS NON-VA MED ORDERS
display_text: Allow Clerks to act on Non-VA Med Orders
value_term: ALLOW CLERKS TO ACT ON NON-VA MED ORDERS
value_help: Enter 0 to prevent clerk entry of non-VA meds, 2 to allow entry and release
description: This parameter determines if clerks (i.e. users holding the OREMAS key)are allowed to act on non-VA med orders.  Enter YES to permit a clerk toenter new or DC non-VA med orders and send them to Pharmacy for reports and order checks. To prohibit clerks from handling non-VA med ordersentirely, select NO.

label: ORWD NONVA REASON
name: ORWD NONVA REASON
value_help: Enter a reason or statement for ordering non-VA meds (60 chars max.)
instance_help: Enter a numeric sequence number for the statement/reason.
description: This parameter lists the reasons and statements for ordering/documenting a non-VA medication.  Non-VA meds include herbals, OTCs (over-the-counter medications) and prescriptions not obtained at VA pharmacies or from VAmail delivery services.

label: ORWOR EXPIRED ORDERS
name: ORWOR EXPIRED ORDERS
display_text: Hours to find recently expired orders
value_help: Enter the number of hours back in time to search for expired orders.
description: Number of hours back in time to search for expired orders.  Also used to determine number of hours back in time to search for expired med orders ifthe follow-up action for the Expiring Meds alert does not find expiringmeds.This parameter does NOT affect Meds tab display.  To alter Meds tab display, please adjust the ORCH CONTEXT MEDS parameter accordingly.

label: ORB REMOVE
name: ORB REMOVE
value_help: Enter 'yes' if the notification can be removed without processing
description: Value indicates if the notification/alert can be deleted without processing.  A "yes" value indicates the notification/alert can be deletedwithout processing.  In the CPRS GUI a"yes" value signifies a selectedalert can be deleted when the Remove button is clicked.  If anotification/alert has a blank value or a "no" value, thenotification/alert cannot be deleted without processing.

label: DENTV DRM EXTRACT FOLDER
name: DENTV DRM EXTRACT FOLDER
description: This is the default file folder for saving history extract (Excel) data.

label: DGQE VIC REQUEST EXPIRATION
name: DGQE VIC REQUEST EXPIRATION
value_help: How many days should a pending VIC request be retained?
description: This parameter defines the number of days that a VIC Request with a CardPrint Release Status of "H"old is allowed to remain pending before being cancelled.

label: DGQE VIC REQUEST PURGE
name: DGQE VIC REQUEST PURGE
value_help: How many days should completed VIC requests be retained?
description: This value is used by the VIC Background Processing [DGQE BACKGROUND PROCESSING] option to determine how many days to retain completed VIC request transactions in the VIC REQUEST (#39.6) and VIC HL7 TRANSMISSIONLOG (#39.7) files.

label: DENTV DRM DAS TURNOFF
name: DENTV DRM DAS TURNOFF
display_text: Turn off sending data to DAS (file 221)
description: This parameter controls the DRM user interface to not allow transactions to be filed to DAS (file 221).  The default date will be 10/31/2004, but if the HL7 interface, or the AAC or VA-DSS determines that they are not ready to turn off DAS, we can change this date.

label: DENTV TX HNPRESETS
name: DENTV TX HNPRESETS
instance_term: Enter Head & Neck Common Findings Text

label: DENTV DRM NOTE WIDTH
name: DENTV DRM NOTE WIDTH
description: This is the word wrap width for note windows in DRM*Plus.  The default SYS value is 74

label: DENTV DRM DEF TX TAB
name: DENTV DRM DEF TX TAB
description: This parameter is used by the new Dental Treatment Planning software to default the correct tab to start the user on.

label: DENTV TP NOTE OBJECTS
name: DENTV TP NOTE OBJECTS
display_text: DRM TREATMENT SYSTEM NOTE DATA OBJECTS
value_help: Enter 0 to turn off, or 1 to turn on
instance_help: Enter the DRM PLUS Note category (see description in the parameter).
description: These parameters determine how the user wants to configure the data objects in the progress note. 0=No, 1=Yes.  The default System instance/values are:CODE BOILERPLATE     0;0;0;0COMPLETED ITEMS      1;0;0;1DENTAL ALERTS        0;0;0;0DIAGNOSTIC FINDINGS  1;0;1;0HEADNECK FINDINGS    1;0;1;1NEXT APPOINTMENT     1;0;0;0NOTE BOILERPLATE     1;0;0;0PERIODONTAL EXAM     1;0;0;0PLANNED ITEMS        1;0;1;0PSR EXAM             1;0;1;0TEXT MARKER          1;0;0;0TOOTH NOTES          1;0;1;1 Position 1 is whether to include the instance type in the Note,Position 2 is whether to include Added items of that typePosition 3 is whether to include Modified items of that typePosition 4 is whether to include Deleted items of that type

label: DENTV TP CODE BOILERPLATE
name: DENTV TP CODE BOILERPLATE
description: This parameter contains word processing templates that are stuffed into the progress note for the associated ADA codes in the Dental transaction.

label: DENTV TP NOTE SEQUENCE
name: DENTV TP NOTE SEQUENCE
description: This parameter contains the sequence that the various data type information is put into the progress note.  The Value information is the INSTANCE value from the DENTV TP NOTE OBJECTS parameter: HEADNECK FINDINGSDIAGNOSTIC FINDINGSPSR EXAMPERIODONTAL EXAMTOOTH NOTESPLANNED ITEMSCODE BOILERPLATECOMPLETED ITEMSNEXT APPOINTMENT

label: DENTV TP DX PROMPT
name: DENTV TP DX PROMPT
display_text: USER OPTION TO ADD DX TO PLANNED ITEMS
description: This parameter saves the user's preference for adding Dx codesto Planned Treatment items.

label: OR GN LOCATIONS
name: OR GN LOCATIONS
value_help: Enter a location that will be used for Group Notes
instance_help: Enter a numeric between 1 and 999 to create an location instance

label: PSB RPT INCL COMMENTS
name: PSB RPT INCL COMMENTS
value_help: Enter 'Y' to default reports to include comments.
description: Determines the default value for the "Include Comments" check box on the report configuration dialog box of the BCMA GUI Client.

label: PSB MED HIST DAYS BACK
name: PSB MED HIST DAYS BACK
value_help: Enter number of days (1-9999, 30 is default)
description: This will store the number of days the Medication History Report date range will default to in the Report Configuration Dialog box of the BCMA GUI Client.

label: LR VER DISPLAY PREV COMMENT
name: LR VER DISPLAY PREV COMMENT
value_help: Answer with yes/no to display previous result's comments during verification.
description: Select whether the user wants comments associated with previous results todisplay with those results during lab verification process.

label: XWBDEBUG
name: XWBDEBUG
description: This parameter controls if the RPC Broker records log data in ^TMP("XWBDBUG",$J).

label: OR BILLING AWARENESS STATUS
name: OR BILLING AWARENESS STATUS
value_help: Enter '1' to enable Billing Awareness or '0' to disable Billing Awareness
description: Status of Billing Awareness Utilization

label: OR BILLING AWARENESS BY USER
name: OR BILLING AWARENESS BY USER
value_help: Enter 1 to enable Billing Awareness for the Clinician or enter 0 to disable
description: This parameter enables the entry of Billing Awareness data in the sign order CPRS window if value is set to 1.  Otherwise the Clinician will not be required to enter Billing Awareness data if value is set to 0.

label: ORQQCSDR CS RANGE START
name: ORQQCSDR CS RANGE START
value_help: Enter start days for CS visits (E.g., T-120)
description: Returns the relative date to start listing visits for a patient on the Cover Sheet.  For example, 'T-90' will list visits beginning 90 days before today.

label: ORQQCSDR CS RANGE STOP
name: ORQQCSDR CS RANGE STOP
value_help: Enter stop days for CS visits (E.g., T+30)
description: Returns the relative date to stop listing visits for a patient on the Cover Sheet.  For example, 'T+2' will list visits ending two days from today.

label: ORQQEAPT ENC APPT START
name: ORQQEAPT ENC APPT START
value_help: Enter start days before Today for Enc Appts (positive number up to 999)
description: Returns the relative number of days before Today to begin listing appointments (0=Today, 1=Today-1 Day, etc.).

label: ORQQEAPT ENC APPT STOP
name: ORQQEAPT ENC APPT STOP
value_help: Enter stop days after Today for Enc Appts (positive number up to 999)
description: Returns the relative number of days from Today to stop listing appointments (0=Today, 1=Today+1 Day, etc.).

label: ORQQEAFL ENC APPT FUTURE LIMIT
name: ORQQEAFL ENC APPT FUTURE LIMIT
display_text: Future Days Limit For PCE Selection
value_term: Future Days Limit For PCE Selection
value_help: Enter number days from today for future appt warning
description: Number of days from Today when warning is given to user upon selection ofa future appointment for Encounters.

label: PXRM GEC STATUS CHECK
name: PXRM GEC STATUS CHECK
value_help: Display the GEC Status Button

label: PXRM WH PRINT NOW
name: PXRM WH PRINT NOW
description: This parameter is use for a site to active the print now option.

label: DENTV TP TREEVIEW DEFAULT
name: DENTV TP TREEVIEW DEFAULT
description: This parameter determines whether DRM objects are the default display within DRM Plus.

label: DENTV DRM VERSION
name: DENTV DRM VERSION
value_help: Enter the last version the user has used, e.g., 4.0.1.0
description: This parameter contains the DRM or DRM Plus version that the user has run last.  If a new version is detected, then a message will alert the user that there may be changes to their system and where to get further information.

label: DENTV DRM PRIMARY PROVIDER
name: DENTV DRM PRIMARY PROVIDER
value_help: Enter YES if this individual can edit Primary/Secondary Providers.
description: This parameter controls which users (other than Admin users) can edit a patient's Primary and Secondary Provider settings.

label: PRCV COTS INVENTORY
name: PRCV COTS INVENTORY
description: This parameter identifies which COTS product is being utilized for the inventory management system of the site.  The current values are: 0       NONE - means no COTS product is being used and the inventory management system in use is GIP/IFCAP1       DYNAMED - means the DynaMed product is being used

label: DGMT MAPR GLOBAL RATE
name: DGMT MAPR GLOBAL RATE
value_help: What is the global MAPR?
instance_help: What is the MT year (YYYY) the rate applies to?
description: Used by $$MEDEXP^DGMTSCU4 to derive gross & adjusted medical expense values.

label: DGMT MAPR 0 DEPENDENTS
name: DGMT MAPR 0 DEPENDENTS
value_help: What is the MAPR rate for zero (0) dependents?
instance_help: What is the MT year (YYYY) the MAPR rate applies to?
description: Used by $$MEDEXP^DGMTSCU4 to derive gross & adjusted medical expense values.

label: DGMT MAPR 1 DEPENDENTS
name: DGMT MAPR 1 DEPENDENTS
value_help: What is the MAPR rate for one (1) dependents?
instance_help: What is the MT year (YYYY) the MAPR rate applies to?
description: Used by $$MEDEXP^DGMTSCU4 to derive gross & adjusted medical expense values.

label: DGMT MAPR N DEPENDENTS
name: DGMT MAPR N DEPENDENTS
value_help: What is the MAPR rate for each dependent more than 1 (n+1)?
instance_help: What is the MT year (YYYY) the MAPR rate applies to?
description: Used by $$MEDEXP^DGMTSCU4 to derive gross & adjusted medical expense values.

label: IB CIDC INSURANCE CHECK
name: IB CIDC INSURANCE CHECK
value_help: Specify how the CIDC related questions should be asked.
description: This parameter is used to set a switch if CIDC related questions shouldbe asked.  Setting this parameter will effect multiple packages and users,therefore great care should be cautioned when editing this parameter.Values are:  0 = Don't ask CIDC related questions for anyone             1 = Ask CIDC related questions only if the patient has active                 billable insurance.             2 = Ask CIDC questions for all patients. This does not over-ride the CPRS switches for how the GUI asks questions,but enhances the limits of the questions for the GUI.

label: ORB OI ORDERED - INPT PR
name: ORB OI ORDERED - INPT PR
display_text: Flag Items for INPT ORDER Providr Recip
value_help: Any one or combination of 'P', 'A', 'T' 'O', 'M', 'E', 'R', 'S' and/or 'C'.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is ordered for an inpatient.  The notification is delivered to a user based upon that user's relationship to the inpatient as defined by the following codes.  Orderable Items can be set up with anyor all of the following codes:  P (Primary Provider): deliver notification to the patient's PrimaryProvider.  A (Attending Physician): deliver notification to the patient's Attending Physician.T (Patient Care Teams): deliver notification to the patient's OE/RR Teams (personal patient and team lists are evaluated for potential recipients) and to devices on an OE/RR team.O (Ordering Provider): deliver notification to the providerwho placed the order which trigger the notification.M (PCMM Team): deliver notification to users/providers linked to thepatient via PCMM Team Position assignments.E (Entering User): deliver notification to the user/provider who entered the order's most recent activity.R (PCMM Primary Care Practitioner): deliver notification to thepatient's PCMM Primary Care Practitioner.S (PCMM Associate Provider): deliver notification to the patient's PCMMAssociate Provider.C (PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator): deliver notification to thepatient's PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator.

label: ORB OI ORDERED - OUTPT PR
name: ORB OI ORDERED - OUTPT PR
display_text: Flag Items for OUTPT ORDER Providr Recip
value_help: Any one or combination of 'P', 'A', 'T', 'O', 'M', 'E', 'R', 'S' and/or 'C'.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is ordered for an outpatient.  The notification is delivered to a user based upon that user's relationship to the outpatient as defined by the following codes.  Orderable Items can be set up with anyor all of the following codes:   P (Primary Provider): deliver notification to the patient's PrimaryProvider.  A (Attending Physician): deliver notification to the patient's Attending Physician.T (Patient Care Teams): deliver notification to the patient's OE/RR Teams (personal patient and team lists are evaluated for potential recipients) and to devices on an OE/RR team.O (Ordering Provider): deliver notification to the providerwho placed the order which trigger the notification.M (PCMM Team): deliver notification to users/providers linked to thepatient via PCMM Team Position assignments.E (Entering User): deliver notification to the user/provider who entered the order's most recent activity.R (PCMM Primary Care Practitioner): deliver notification to thepatient's PCMM Primary Care Practitioner.S (PCMM Associate Provider): deliver notification to the patient's PCMMAssociate Provider.C (PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator): deliver notification to thepatient's PCMM Mental Health Treatment Coordinator.

label: DENTV DRM ANCILLARY
name: DENTV DRM ANCILLARY
description: This parameter is multi-instance for the purpose of knowing which ancillary products can be launched from within DRM Plus.  It enables, or hides, the appropriate buttons for the user.  For example, DRM Plus can launch MiPACS to view dental radiographs, and iMedConsent to get required consent forms. Instance name            Value            Entity----------------        ---------         ----------MiPACS                   soc Y/N          SystemiMedConsent              soc Y/N          SystemiMedConsentLoc          server location   System

label: DENTV TX ALERTPRESETS
name: DENTV TX ALERTPRESETS
description: These values display for user selection of dental alerts for a patient.

label: DENTV DRM USER LOCATION
name: DENTV DRM USER LOCATION
value_help: Enter the default location for this user
description: This parameter contains the default location for the user.  The location will display when a user creates a new visit in DRM Plus.

label: XUS CCOW VAULT PARAM
name: XUS CCOW VAULT PARAM
value_help: Enter the first chunk of the CCOW passcode.
description: This parameter holds the application passcode for the CCOW vault.

label: PRCPLO REPORT RANGE
name: PRCPLO REPORT RANGE
value_help: Enter a number of days to be used for the PRCPLO REPORT RANGE.
description: This parameter will be used to indicate the date range for the Day of Stock on Hand report associated with PRC*5.1*83 (CLRS).

label: PRCPLO INACTIVITY RANGE
name: PRCPLO INACTIVITY RANGE
value_help: Enter a number of days to be used as the PRCPLO INACTIVITY RANGE.
description: This parameter will be used to indicate the number of days to be used for the inactive range for the Stock Status Report by PRC*5.1*83 (CLRS).

label: PRCPLO GREATER THAN RANGE
name: PRCPLO GREATER THAN RANGE
value_help: Enter number of days to be used as the PRCPLO GREATER THAN RANGE.
description: This parameter will be used to indicate the number of days to be used in connection with the Stock on Hand Report when that report evaluates stock levels retained greater than a certain given period.  This parameter is associated with PRC*5.1*83 (CLRS).

label: PRCPLO EXTRACT DIRECTORY
name: PRCPLO EXTRACT DIRECTORY
value_help: Enter the directory to be used as the PRCPLO EXTRACT DIRECTORY.
description: This parameter will be used to indicate the destination directory for extracts taken in connection with PRC*5.1*83 (CLRS).  These directories would be at the VMS, Windows, Linux, or other operating system level.

label: GMV DLL VERSION
name: GMV DLL VERSION
description: This parameter is used to store the DLL versions that are compatible withthe current server version of the Vitals/Measurements application. TheInstance format is DLL:VERSION. Example:  GMV_VITALSVIEWENTER.DLL:v. 07/21/05 10:34

label: DG PT DIRECTORY CALL CENTER
name: DG PT DIRECTORY CALL CENTER
value_help: to enable the parameter set it to 1, otherwise set it to 0 or leave it blank.
description: Enabling this parameter will allow for the transmission of the privacy indicator to be included in HL7 messages generated by the Registration application in the PV2 segment. The privacy indicator allows patient to opt-out form being listed from facility directories. By including this information in the HL7 message the information can be communicated to COTSapplications doing patient directories.

label: ORB SORT DIRECTION
name: ORB SORT DIRECTION
value_help: F:Forward, R:Reverse
description: Direction for sorting notifications when displayed in the CPRS GUI. Directions include: Forward and Reverse.

label: ORWG GRAPH SETTING
name: ORWG GRAPH SETTING
description: Used as preference of graph default styles and sources.Deletion of this value at the Package level will disable graphing.User settings and public default should use the Graph Settings dialog tochange these values. The structure of this parameter is a  |  delimited string where the pieces are:1 - file listing delimited by  ; 2 - options where the corresponding letter activates that feature3 - sort column number (used internally)4 - max graphs5 - min graph height6 - (not used)7 - max selection8 - max selection limit (may be set to at system level to limit     number of items that users may select for graphing   default is 1000) Files:Admissions - 405, Allergies - 120.8, Anatomic  Pathology - 63AP,Blood Bank - 63BB, Exams - 9000010.13, Health Factors - 9000010.23,Immunizations - 9000010.11, Lab Tests - 63, Medication, BCMA - 53.79,Medication, Inpatient - 55, Medication, Non-VA - 55NVA, Medication, Outpatient - 52, Medicine - 690, Mental Health - 601.2,Microbiology - 63MI, Notes - 8925, Orders - 100,Patient Education - 9000010.16, Problems - 9000011, Procedures - 9000010.18,Purpose of Visit - 9000010.07, Radiology Exams - 70, Registration, DX - 45DX,Registration, OP/Proc - 45OP, Skin Tests - 9000010.12, Surgery - 130,Treatments - 9000010.15, Visits - 9000010, Vitals - 120.5Also (for grouping):Drug Class - 50.605, Reminder Taxonomy - 811.2 Options: A - 3D, B - Clear Background, C - Dates, D - Gradient, E - Hints, F - Legend, G - Lines, H - Sort by Type, I - Stay on Top, J - Values,K - Zoom, Horizontal, L - Zoom, Vertical , M - Fixed Date Range

label: ORWG GRAPH VIEW
name: ORWG GRAPH VIEW
instance_help: The view name must be 3-30 characters
description: This parameter is used internally to store graph views.Graph views are edited using the Define Views dialog.

label: ORB REMOVE NON-OR
name: ORB REMOVE NON-OR
value_term: Enable removing this type of alert?
value_help: Enter "yes" to enable removing this type of alert via Remove button.
instance_help: Enter Alert identifier for type of alert you wish to remove.
description: Indicates if a non-CPRS (non-OERR) alert can be deleted withoutprocessing.  Enter the alert identifier (or a portion of the alertidentifier) for each type of alert you want to be able to remove in the CPRS GUI via the Remove button.  The alert identifier or XQAID can befound in the ALERT ID field of the ALERT file [#8992].  For this parameteruse the first few characters of the ALERT ID. For example, to remove NOISalerts enter FSC.  You may enter as many alert identifiers as desired.  Please note that most alert IDs include information specific to thepatient or instance which triggered the alert.  For this parameter youshould only enter that portion of the alert ID which is consistent for allalerts of this type.  For example, a NOIS alert's ID might actually looklike FSC-M,275546.  Entering the entire alert ID in this parameter willonly allow removal of this specific alert.  However if the parameter valueis FSC, all NOIS alerts can be removed.  Other examples of non-OR alertIDs include:  NO-ID;17;3040628.131502   [Taskman alert] - use NO-ID in parameterTIUERR,3423,1;1450;3040518.125801   [TIU error alert] - use TIUERRTIU28907;17;3040720.134827   [TIU alert] - use TIU* in parameter  *Using TIU will also enable Removing TIUERR alerts.  Use TIUERR if youonly want to Remove TIUERR alerts.

label: OR ALLERGY ENTERED IN ERROR
name: OR ALLERGY ENTERED IN ERROR
display_text: Mark allergy/adr as entered in error
value_term: Allow marking entry as entered in error
value_help: Enter YES if user should be allowed to use the entered in error functionality
description: This parameter will control whether or not a user has access tothe entered in error functionality available on the cover sheetin CPRS GUI.

label: ORWPFSS ACTIVE
name: ORWPFSS ACTIVE
value_help: Enter '1' to activate PFSS or '0' to deactivate PFSS for CPRS
description: Parameter to tell CPRS if it needs to perform the PFSS functionality.

label: ORWG GRAPH PUBLIC EDITOR CLASS
name: ORWG GRAPH PUBLIC EDITOR CLASS
value_help: Enter the User Class for public editing of graphs.
instance_help: Enter a sequential number for identifying the user class.
description: This parameter contains a list of ASU user classes who's members are allowed to edit public views and settings for graphs. Users that belong to the userclass entered at the SYSTEM level have this authority.

label: ORWG GRAPH EXCLUDE DATA TYPE
name: ORWG GRAPH EXCLUDE DATA TYPE
description: Used to exclude data types from being used by graphing.Value is semicolon delimited list of files to be excluded.

label: ORWRP VISTAWEB ADDRESS
name: ORWRP VISTAWEB ADDRESS
value_help: Enter the Web Address to access VistaWeb, excluding parameters.

label: ORWG GRAPH SIZING
name: ORWG GRAPH SIZING
description: This parameter is used internally to save positions of graph forms.

label: ORWRP CIRN AUTOMATIC
name: ORWRP CIRN AUTOMATIC
value_help: Enter YES to enable auto query of all remote sites
description: This parameter determines if Remote patient queries are done automaticallyfor all sites.  The values for this parameter can be controlled down to theUSER entity.

label: ORWRP HDR ON
name: ORWRP HDR ON
display_text: Turn Remote Queries to HDR on
value_term: TURN REMOTE QUERIES TO HDR ON
value_help: Enter YES to enable remote queries to the HDR
description: This parameter determines if Remote patient queries are done to the HDR.The values for this parameter can be controlled down to theUSER entity.

label: BPS USRSCR
name: BPS USRSCR
display_text: Display claims for ONE or ALL users

description: This parameter is a numeric value containing the number of patients to be displayed per page.

description: This parameter contains the maximum number of patients returned.
