description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator may choose 3 fields to bedisplayed by the Patient Lookup application in the search list.

label: DGRR PL ROOM BED
name: DGRR PL ROOM BED
value_help: Please enter E if the Room/Bed parameter should be enabled.
description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator may choose 3 fields to bedisplayed by the Patient Lookup application in the search list.

label: DGRR PL SERVICE CONNECTED
name: DGRR PL SERVICE CONNECTED
value_help: Please enter an E if the Service Connected parameter should be enabled.
description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator may choose 3 fields to bedisplayed by the Patient Lookup application in the search list.

label: DGRR PL VETERAN STATUS
name: DGRR PL VETERAN STATUS
value_help: Please enter an E if the Veteran Status parameter should be enabled.
description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator may choose 3 fields to bedisplayed by the Patient Lookup application in the search list.

label: DGRR PL WARD
name: DGRR PL WARD
value_help: Please enter an E if the Ward parameter should be enabled.
description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator may choose 3 fields to bedisplayed by the Patient Lookup application in the search list.

label: DGRR PL VETERAN IMAGE
name: DGRR PL VETERAN IMAGE
value_help: Enter E if image parameter should enabled or D if it should be disabled.
description: A user holding the DGRR PLU Administrator security key may set thisparameter.  If enabled, the veteran image will be displayed.

label: XUSNPI QUALIFIED IDENTIFIER
name: XUSNPI QUALIFIED IDENTIFIER
description: This is a mapping of NPI ID name to the files that hold the data.

label: PSB VDL PATCH DAYS
name: PSB VDL PATCH DAYS
value_help: Enter a number (days) a GIVEN medication patch displays on the VDL.
instance_help: Enter a value between 7 and 14.
description: PSB VDL PATCH DAYS - The value of this parameter should be between 7 and 14. PSB VDL PATCH DAYS is the parameter which determines the number of days a patient's GIVEN medication patch will display on the respective BarCode Medication Administration (BCMA) Virtual Due List (VDL) and BCMA Coversheet.  If this parameter is equal to the  "null" value, a GIVEN medication patch will always display on the respective BCMA VDL and BCMA Coversheet.

label: PSB COVERSHEET VIEWS COL SORT
name: PSB COVERSHEET VIEWS COL SORT
value_help: Enter column number per coversheet view sorting, delimited by "/"
instance_help: Enter column number per coversheet view sorting, delimited by "/"
description: This is a USER SPECIFIC PARAMETER. This parameter contains 4 column number used to sort each of the 4 different Coversheet Views respectively, delimited by the slash (/)                                                                character.  First (Medication Overview),  Second (PRN Overview), Third (IVOverview), and Forth (Expired/Expiring Orders), are the coversheet views in sequence.  Each view's columns are numbered from left to right.  An example parameter setting is:             7/3/1/3

label: PSB COVERSHEET V1 COL WIDTHS
name: PSB COVERSHEET V1 COL WIDTHS
value_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 1 col delimited with "/"
instance_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 1 col delimited with "/"
description: USER specific setting for the BCMA Coversheet's "first view" . This parameter contains the width of each column viewed via the Bar Code Medication Administration Coversheet's "first view" delimited by the slash (/).  Each "/"-piece of data is per respective column on the Coversheet's "first view", numbered from left to right.  An example parameter setting is:       170/20/100/30/11/22/31/44/50 Setting numbers are in units of centimeters.    THESE NUMBERS MUST BE WHOLE NUMBERS.

label: PSB COVERSHEET V2 COL WIDTHS
name: PSB COVERSHEET V2 COL WIDTHS
value_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 2 col delimited with "/"
instance_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 2 col delimited with "/"
description: USER specific setting for the BCMA Coversheet's "second view". This parameter contains the width of each column viewed via the Bar Code Medication Administration Coversheet's "second view" delimited by theslash (/).  Each "/"-piece of data is per respective column on the Coversheet's "second view", numbered from left to right.  An example parameter setting is:       170/20/100/30/11/22/31/44/50 Setting numbers are in units of centimeters.    THESE NUMBERS MUST BE WHOLE NUMBERS.

label: PSB COVERSHEET V3 COL WIDTHS
name: PSB COVERSHEET V3 COL WIDTHS
value_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 3 col delimited with "/"
instance_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 3 col delimited with "/"
description: USER specific setting for the BCMA Coversheet's "third view".        This parameter contains the width of each column viewed via the Bar Code Medication Administration Coversheet's "third view" delimited by theslash (/).  Each "/"-piece of data is per respective column on the Coversheet's "third view", numbered from left to right.  An example parameter setting is:       170/20/100/30/11/22/31/44/50 Setting numbers are in units of centimeters.    THESE NUMBERS MUST BE WHOLE NUMBERS.

label: PSB COVERSHEET V4 COL WIDTHS
name: PSB COVERSHEET V4 COL WIDTHS
value_help: Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 4 col delimited with "/"
instance_help: : Enter the widths for each Coversheet View 4 delimited with "/"
description: USER specific setting for the BCMA Coversheet's "forth view".                                                                         This parameter contains the width of each column viewed via the Bar Code Medication Administration Coversheet's "forth view" delimited by the slash (/).  Each "/"-piece of data is per respective column on the Coversheet's "forth view", numbered from left to right.  An example parameter setting is:       170/20/100/30/11/22/31/44/50 Setting numbers are in units of centimeters.    THESE NUMBERS MUST BE WHOLE NUMBERS.

label: PSB MG ADMIN ERROR
name: PSB MG ADMIN ERROR
value_help: Enter Mail Group to get error messages.
description: This parameter is the name of the mail group containing persons to get electronic mail messages, when a BCMA administration is filed with a "null" value in the Action Status field (#.09).

label: MD MEDICINE CONVERTED
name: MD MEDICINE CONVERTED
description: Used to determine if the Medicine Package has been converted.

label: XPD PATCH HFS SERVER
name: XPD PATCH HFS SERVER
value_help: The Domain name of the Patch Module server
description: This field holds the name of the server to send e-mail to when a KIDS HFS file is made.

label: DGPF QUERY TRY LIMIT
name: DGPF QUERY TRY LIMIT
display_text: Patient Record Flags Query Try Limit
value_help: Enter the maximum number of PRF query attempts to allow.
description: This value is used by the Patient Record Flags module to control the maximum number of query attempts that are allowed.

label: DENTV DRM ELIGIBILITY
name: DENTV DRM ELIGIBILITY
value_help: Enter ues if this individual can edit dental patient eligibility information.
description: This parameter determines whether or not a user can edit dental patient eligibility information on the DRM Plus Cover Page.

label: DENTV DRM NO VISIT CREATE
name: DENTV DRM NO VISIT CREATE
display_text: Don't allow creation of PCE visits
description: This parameter controls whether or not users may add PCE visit 'on the fly' within DRM Plus.  If set to yes, then no visits can be created and the user must select an existing PCE visit for the dental encounter.

label: DENTV DRM DUPCHECK OFF
name: DENTV DRM DUPCHECK OFF
description: This parameter controls whether or not the users see the Potential Duplicates screen which attempts to synchronize planned and completed care.  If set to yes, then no duplicate processing is done.  If not defined, or set to no, (the default) then potential dupes will be shown to the user for selection/processing.

label: PRC CLRS ADDRESS
name: PRC CLRS ADDRESS
value_help: Enter the IP address or DNS Server name identified as the location of the CLRS.
description: This parameter will store the location of the Clinical Logistics Report Server in either IP address or DNS Server name form.  An error notification will be sent through MailMan if no value is present in this parameter when a transfer to the CLRS is attempted.

label: PRC CLRS OUTLOOK MAILGROUP
name: PRC CLRS OUTLOOK MAILGROUP
value_help: Enter the Microsoft Outlook mail group that should receive CLRS notifications.
description: This parameter will hold the name of the Microsoft Outlook mail group that should receive Clinical Logistics Report Server activity notifications.  The mail group name must be completely and accurately entered for this functionality to operate correctly.

label: OR RDI CACHE TIME
name: OR RDI CACHE TIME
value_help: Length of time RDI should cache HDR data for order checking
description: This parameter enables sites to determine the amount of time data will be cached and considered valid for ordering checking before that data would need to be refreshed. The value is in minutes and can be set from 0 to 9999.

label: OR RDI HAVE HDR
name: OR RDI HAVE HDR
value_help: DOES THIS SYSTEM HAVE AN HDR
description: The value in this parameter shows if a health data repository exists from which remote data from other VHA facilities and Department of Defense medical facilities is retrieved.  This parameter supports theVistAOffice application that can work as a stand-alone application.

label: ORRDI FAIL THRESH
name: ORRDI FAIL THRESH
value_help: Enter the number of failures to set the threshold at
description: This parameter is a threshold value that holds the minimum number of HDR read failures for RDI before RDI will go into a state of "OUTAGE"  What this means is that when an OUTAGE state is encountered, RDI will no longer perform real time HDR read attempts but will instead display to the user the "Local Data Only" message.

label: ORRDI SUCCEED THRESH
name: ORRDI SUCCEED THRESH
value_help: Enter the number of successful reads to set the threshold at
description: This parameter is a threshold value that holds the minimum number of successfull HDR reads for RDI before RDI will come out of the OUTAGE state.  The successfull reads are peformed in a task that is spawned when the OUTAGE state is initiated.

label: ORRDI PING FREQ
name: ORRDI PING FREQ
value_help: Enter the number of seconds to wait between HDR ping attempts
description: This parameter represents the number of seconds between the initiation of attempts to ping the HDR for a successful read.  This pinging takes place when an OUTAGE state is encountered for RDI.

label: ORRDI DUMMY ICN
name: ORRDI DUMMY ICN
value_help: Enter a fake ICN for the RDI ping test
description: This parameter represents the fake ICN that will be used to perform the ping messages to the HDR when an OUTAGE state is encountered within RDI.

label: XHD PRISM DESKTOP THEME
name: XHD PRISM DESKTOP THEME
value_help: Please specify the Theme to be used for the Desktop.
description: This parameter determines what Theme (i.e., HealtheVet Desktop Theme or current Windows Theme) to apply to the Desktop.

label: PSB TOOLS MENU
name: PSB TOOLS MENU
value_help: Example:  Notepad=C:\WINDOWS\NOTEPAD.EXE
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which this menu item should appear.
description: This parameter may be used to identify which items should appear on the tools menu which is displayed by the BCMA GUI.  Each item should contain a name that should be displayed on the menu, followed by an equal sign, followed by the command string used to invoke the executable.  This string may also include parameters that are passed to the executable.Some example entries are:  Hospital Policy=C:\WINNT\SYSTEM32\VIEWERS\QUIKVIEW.EXE LOCPLCY.DOCVISTA Terminal=C:\PROGRA~1\KEA\KEAVT.EXE VISTA.KTC  An ampersand may be used in the name portion to identify a letter thatshould be underlined on the menu for quick keyboard access.  For example,to underscore the letter H in Hospital Policy, enter &Hospital Policy asthe name part.

label: PSB RPT MAX RANGE
name: PSB RPT MAX RANGE
value_help: Enter the maximum range (# of days) for a BCMA report to process
description: PSB RPT MAX RANGE is to support the sites ability to limit the range of days a BCMA report will be allowed to process.  For example, when this parameter is set to 7 , a BCMA report will be able to process data in a range of 7 days such as Jan 1 - Jan 8, 2007.  This will assist in limiting the allocation of resources when processing a BCMA report.

label: SDSC SITE PARAMETER
name: SDSC SITE PARAMETER
value_help: Enter a number between 1-99999.
instance_help: Enter a number between 1-99999.

label: MD CLINIC QUICK LIST
name: MD CLINIC QUICK LIST
value_help: Select a procedure for the clinic.
instance_help: Enter clinics that need CP studies to be checked-in.
description: List of clinics used as a source to get a list of patientsthat need to have CP studies checked-in.  This only appliesto studies with procedures that have multiple results suchas Hemodialysis, Respiratory Therapy, and sleep studies.

label: MD CHECK-IN PROCEDURE LIST
name: MD CHECK-IN PROCEDURE LIST
value_help: Enter 0 for None, 1 for Outpatient, 2 for Inpatient, or 3 for both.
instance_help: Enter procedures that needs the study to be auto checked-in.
description: This parameter contains a list of procedures that will be usedto auto check-in the CP studies during the procedures request in CPRS.

label: MD USE APPT WITH PROCEDURE
name: MD USE APPT WITH PROCEDURE
description: Enter "Y" or "N" for Yes/No on whether your site selects the appointmentscheduled for outpatients during the procedure request in CPRS.

label: MD CLINICS WITH MULT PROC
name: MD CLINICS WITH MULT PROC
value_help: Enter a clinic for the procedure.
instance_help: Enter a procedure.
description: If you have a clinic for multiple procedures, populate thisparameter with the procedure and associate it to a clinic.

label: DG HTH DEFAULT WAIT TIME
name: DG HTH DEFAULT WAIT TIME
display_text: Enter time in minutes to wait for AAs
value_help: Enter number of minutes to wait for application acknowledgements.

label: DG HTH # OF RETRANSMITS
name: DG HTH # OF RETRANSMITS
value_help: Enter the number retransmissions to attempt

label: DG HTH EXTENDED WAIT TIME
name: DG HTH EXTENDED WAIT TIME
display_text: Enter extended wait time to wait for AAs
value_term: EXTENDED TIME TO WAIT FOR AA
value_help: Enter the number of extended minutes to wait for application acknowledgements.

label: PSB BKUP DOM FILTER
name: PSB BKUP DOM FILTER
value_help: Should the contingency backup filter out DOM patients?
description: This parameter is used by the BCMA backup system to determine if DOM patients are included in the backup.  If the value is set to YES, DOM patients will be filtered out of the backup and will not be sent to the workstation.  If the value is NO or blank, DOM patients will be sent to the backup workstation.

label: MD DAYS TO RETAIN COM STUDY
name: MD DAYS TO RETAIN COM STUDY
value_help: Enter the number of days from 1 to 365
description: The number of days after check-in date/time to display the studythat has been completed in the CPUser application.  Studies that haveprocedures with multiple or cumulative results are NOT included.Cumulative and multiple results studies will have a default value of365.

label: MD COMPL PROC DISPLAY DAYS
name: MD COMPL PROC DISPLAY DAYS
value_help: Enter the number of days from 1 to 365
description: The number of days the completed procedure requests will bedisplayed in the CP Check-in screen.

label: MD APPOINT START DATE
name: MD APPOINT START DATE
value_help: Enter a number from 0 to 365.
description: Enter a number from 0 to 365 for the number of days that will beused to subtract from today as the start date range of the EncounterAppointments.  If no value is entered, the default value usedwill be 200.

label: MD APPOINT END DATE
name: MD APPOINT END DATE
value_help: Enter a number from 0 to 365.
description: Enter a number from 0 to 365 for the number of days that will beused to add to today as the end date range of the EncounterAppointments.  If no value is entered, the default value usedwill be 0.

label: MDK GUI VERSION
name: MDK GUI VERSION
description: This parameter is used to store the application:versions that are compatiblewith the current server version of Hemodialysis.  Instance formatof APPLICATION:VERSION  (example: HEMODIALYSIS.EXE:0.0.0.0).

label: MDK APPLICATION INSTALL
name: MDK APPLICATION INSTALL
description: This parameter is used to store the Hemodialysis applicationdistribution information.  The information includes the following:1) Date/Time when application first launched.2) User Name3) System Option Loaded (Y/N)4) Workstation of where the application was launched.

label: CRHD DNR ORDER TITLE
name: CRHD DNR ORDER TITLE
description: if an orderable item  for DNR can not be found in the list of orders than look for a text order using this parameter value list.

label: CRHD DNR ORDERABLE ITEMS
name: CRHD DNR ORDERABLE ITEMS
display_text: Shift Chg Handoff Tool DNR Order Titles

label: CRHD TEMP FLD EXPIRE
name: CRHD TEMP FLD EXPIRE
display_text: Shift Change Handoff Temp field Expire

label: DENTV COVER PAGE ONLY
name: DENTV COVER PAGE ONLY
display_text: User only has access to the Cover Page
value_help: Enter Yes if this individual can ONLY see the DRM Plus Cover Page.
description: This parameter determines whether or not the user only has access to the DRM Plus Cover Page.

label: DENTV DRM NO PCE DELETE
name: DENTV DRM NO PCE DELETE
description: This parameter controls whether or not PCE will be automatically updated when the user deletes transactions in DRM Plus.  If set to yes, then the system will attempt to delete the transactions (CPT codes, ICD-9 codes and Providers).  If set to no, then the user will be prompted to manually 'fix' the PCE data.

label: OR DC REASON LIST
name: OR DC REASON LIST
value_help: Enter the sequence you want the order DC reason to appear.
description: This parameter determines the sequence sites want the order DC reasons to  appear. Sites do not need to set a sequence for every DC Reasons.For example if a site wants to set the "Requesting Physician Cancelled" DC Reasons to the top of the list. Sites will set a value  of 1 for thatentry and CPRS will display the rest of the DC Reasons after the"Requesting Physician Cancelled"  DC reason.

label: OR MEDS TAB SORT
name: OR MEDS TAB SORT
value_domain: 1:Status/Exp. Date;2:Status Group/Status/Loc./Drug name;3:Drug, status active, status recent expired

label: OR ADMIN TIME HELP TEXT
name: OR ADMIN TIME HELP TEXT
description: This parameter determines the information that is displayed in the Administration Time Information pop-up or Hover Hint that is displayed to the user. The pop-up includes the administration times for the dose and the help text defined in this parameter.

label: OR FLAGGED ORD REASONS
name: OR FLAGGED ORD REASONS
value_help: Enter a generic reason for flagging an order (1-80 characters)
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which the reason should appear in the displayed list
description: This parameter allows sites to enter generic reason's for flagging orders that the users can choose in the CPRS GUI.

label: OR LAPSE ORDERS
name: OR LAPSE ORDERS
value_help: ENTER THE NUMBER OF DAYS TO KEEP UNSIGNED/UNRELEASED ORDERS BEFORE LAPSING THEM
instance_help: ENTER A DISPLAY GROUP
description: The purpose of this parameter is to store the number of days that old orders will be lapsed.  This parameter is multi valued with an instance term of DISPLAY GROUPS.  Thus the way it works is that you can set "Display Group A" so that old orders from this display group will lapse in 10 days for instance.  Then you could have "Display Group B" set so that those orders would lapse when they are 20 days old. Display groupsnot individually set by this parameter are affected by the OR LAPSE ORDERS DFLT parameter.  By lapsing, it is meant that the order is placed in a LAPSED status.Also see the description for parameter OR LAPSE ORDERS DFLT.

label: OR LAPSE ORDERS DFLT
name: OR LAPSE ORDERS DFLT
value_help: ENTER THE NUMBER OF DAYS TO KEEP UNSIGNED/UNRELEASED ORDERS BEFORE LAPSING THEM
description: The purpose of this parameter is to store the number of days that old orders will be lapsed when those orders are from a DISPLAY GROUP that does not have parameter OR LAPSE ORDERS set.  The default value that is set in this parameter will affect all orders that do not have a specific DISPLAY GROUP value.  Thus if both "Display Group A" and "Display Group B" have parameter OR LAPSE ORDERS set for them but "Display Group C" does not, then orders from "Display Group C" will get lapsed in the number of days specified in OR LAPSE ORDERS DFLT.

label: OR CLOZ INPT MSG
name: OR CLOZ INPT MSG
display_text: MSG TO DISPLAY ON INPT ORD OF CLOZAPINE
value_term: MSG TO DISPLAY ON INPT ORD OF CLOZAPINE
value_help: Enter a message to display when an Inpat. Order of Clozapine is made
description: This parameter allows sites to set what text they would like for users to see when an inpatient order of Clozapine is made.  This drug is generally ordered in an outpatient setting and thus is subject to the special order appropriateness checks.  However, when ordered in an inpatient setting these checks are not done.  Thus sites should determine a policy to handle this and provide instructions to users based on that policy.

label: ORWLR LC CHANGED TO WC
name: ORWLR LC CHANGED TO WC
display_text: MESSAGE FOR LC CHANGED TO WC
value_help: Enter up to 80 characters of instructions to the user.
description: When the system automatically changes lab collect orders to ward collect, provides instructions to the user regarding specimen collection for those changed orders.

label: OR VBECS SUPPRESS NURS ADMIN
name: OR VBECS SUPPRESS NURS ADMIN
value_help: Enter 'Yes' if you wish to suppress the Nursing Admin Order Prompt
description: This parameter disables the prompt/pop-up that tells the user they mustenter a Nursing Administration Order manually after entering a VBECSBlood order.  Disabling this feature is usually done when a NursingAdministration order has been created and added to a VBECS order set.

label: OR RA RFS CARRY ON
name: OR RA RFS CARRY ON
value_help: Enter yes or no for whether to carry on the value of Reason for Study
description: This value will determine if CPRS will carry on the text entered in the Reason for Study field of the Radiology (Imaging) order dialog.  By carry on, it is meant that when one order is entered the value entered in the Reason for Study field will be held and used again in subsequent Radiology orders.

label: ORWDXVB VBECS TNS CHECK
name: ORWDXVB VBECS TNS CHECK
display_text: Days to check for Type & Screen
value_help: Enter the number of days to check for a Type & Screen Order
description: This is used in the VBECS Order Dialog to check for recent orders for aType & Screen order.  The default is 3 days, but a site can override thisnumber by setting this parameter to something different.

label: OR VBECS ON
name: OR VBECS ON
value_help: Enter 'yes' to turn on VBECS at site.
description: 'Yes' indicates that VBECS functionality is enabled.

label: PSB MG SCANNING FAILURES
name: PSB MG SCANNING FAILURES
description: Mailgroup to notify when an item is documented as not able to be scanned.

label: DENTV TP PROMPT CODEBP
name: DENTV TP PROMPT CODEBP
description: This parameter determines whether the user will be prompted to reimport the Code Boilerplate when going back to the note after clicking 'Back' and 'Next'.  If NO (or not defined) then the Code BP will be automatically imported, if YES, then the user will be prompted and can have the option of not importing the Code Boilerplate into the note.

label: DENTV DRM MONITORED DATA
name: DENTV DRM MONITORED DATA
display_text: HIGHLIGHT MONITORED DATE ON COVER PAGE
value_help: Enter the number of days back to change the Monitored Exam backgounnd color
description: This field changes the background color on the cover page for the Monitored Exam field.  If the date is older than the number of days in the parameter, then the default color will change to white to highlight the older date.

label: OR VBECS COMPONENT ORDER
name: OR VBECS COMPONENT ORDER
value_help: Select a Blood Component for VBECS
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which the component should appear in the selection list
description: This parameter allows a sequence to be assigned to Blood Componentsselectable from VBECS.

label: OR VBECS MODIFIERS
name: OR VBECS MODIFIERS
value_help: Enter a blood component modifier
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which the modifier should appear in the selection list
description: This parameter allows local configuration of the blood component modifiers.

label: OR VBECS REASON FOR REQUEST
name: OR VBECS REASON FOR REQUEST
value_help: Enter a reason for request
instance_help: Enter the sequence in which the reason should appear in the selection list
description: This parameter allows local configuration of the Reasons for Request.

label: OR VBECS LEGACY REPORT
name: OR VBECS LEGACY REPORT
value_help: Enter 'yes' to show Legacy Blood Bank Report
description: 'Yes' will show the Legacy (VISTA) blood bank report afterthe VBECS blood bank report.

label: OR VBECS ERROR MESSAGE
name: OR VBECS ERROR MESSAGE
value_help: Enter text to be displayed when CPRS cannot communicate with VBECS.
description: This parameter holds the text to be displayed when the VBECS order dialogis selected but the communication links between CPRS and VBECS are down.Site-specific directions for initiating blood bank orders are encouragedto be put here at the System or Division level.

label: MD USE APPOINTMENT
name: MD USE APPOINTMENT
description: Set this value to Yes to allow CPUser to use the location of theappointment selected during CP study check-in for the workload.Otherwise, the hospital location of the CP Definition will be used.If no value is entered, the default value is No.

label: MD CLINIC ASSOCIATION
name: MD CLINIC ASSOCIATION
instance_help: Enter the sequence to associate a clinic and procedure.
description: This parameter is used to identify the clinic and procedureassociation.  Each item should be entered with the following format   Clinic internal entry number_";"_Procedure internal entry number

label: MD OLYMPUS 7
name: MD OLYMPUS 7
value_help: Enter Yes/No whether you have Olympus version 7.3.7.
description: This parameter definition indicates whether the Olympus deviceis version 7.3.7.  The value is Yes/No.  The default valueis "No".

label: PRCPLO USER NAME
name: PRCPLO USER NAME
value_help: Enter user name for CLRS report server login
description: This parameter will store the user login name for the Clinical Logistics Report Server.

label: PRCPLO PASSWORD
name: PRCPLO PASSWORD
value_help: Enter password for CLRS report server login
description: This parameter will store the user login password for the ClinicalLogistics Report Server.

label: PRCPLO REGIONAL ACQ CENTER
name: PRCPLO REGIONAL ACQ CENTER
value_help: Please enter Regional Acquisition Center to group Purchase Order transactions
description: This parameter will store the Regional Acquisition Center which will be populated by the station and used to group Purchase Order transactions.

label: DSIV CONVERSION
name: DSIV CONVERSION
description: This parameter will determine if this user is allowed access to the conversion utilities in the DocManager GUI.

label: DSIV DOCMAN VI DELETE
name: DSIV DOCMAN VI DELETE
value_term: Allow VI Bkgnd Process to delete file
value_help: Enter YES if the VI BP should delete the file after importing it to VI
description: The parameter controls whether or not the site wants the import image file deleted from the network directory by the VistA Imaging Background Processor after the BP has imported the file.  The BP will delete the file if told to do so whether or not it successfully imports the image.  The usual exception to this occurs when the BP process does not RWD rights to the folder where the image resides.

label: DSIV DOCMAN CONSULT SIGNATURE
name: DSIV DOCMAN CONSULT SIGNATURE
value_term: Prompt for sig when closing a consult
value_help: Enter YES if Docman should prompt user for e-sig when completing a consult
description: This parameter will control whether or not the DocManager GUI application should present the consult signature edit box when completing a consult.

label: DSIV DOCMAN INDEX INFO
name: DSIV DOCMAN INDEX INFO
value_help: This should only be edited via Docman GUI application
description: This will store an individual user's settings for indexing documents

label: DSIV IMPORT USER2
name: DSIV IMPORT USER2
description: This parameter controls user access for importing images in DocManager.

label: DSIV ALLOW EC FULL EDIT
name: DSIV ALLOW EC FULL EDIT
description: ALLOWS ENTRY CLERKS ACCESS TO THE GUI EDIT SCREEN.

label: DSIV ALLOW EC LIST VIEW
name: DSIV ALLOW EC LIST VIEW
display_text: ALLOW ENTRY CLERKS TO VIEW BUFFER LIST
description: ALLOW ENTRY CLERKS TO VIEW BUFFER LIST TAB DISPLAY.

label: DSIV ALLOW GROUP PLAN EDIT
name: DSIV ALLOW GROUP PLAN EDIT
display_text: ALLOW EDITING OF GROUP POLICY FIELDS
description: This parameter controls whether the group policy fields may be edited.

label: DSIV APPT FILTER
name: DSIV APPT FILTER
description: This parameter determines how appointments are filtered out in the patient update list for ICB.  0=not filtered  1=filter out checked-in status (this also filters checked-out status)  2=filter out checked-out status

label: DSIV APPT LIST COLUMN SORT
name: DSIV APPT LIST COLUMN SORT
display_text: PATIENT UPDATE LIST USER COLUMN SORT
description: This is the user preference setting for patient update list column sort.

label: DSIV APPTS DAYS BACK
name: DSIV APPTS DAYS BACK
display_text: DAYS BACK TO RETRIEVE APPOINTMENTS LIST
value_help: ENTER A VALUE BETWEEN 0 AND 999999
description: NUMBER OF DAYS BACK TO RETRIEVE APPOINTMENTS LIST.

label: DSIV BUFFER DAYS BACK
name: DSIV BUFFER DAYS BACK
display_text: DAYS BACK TO RETRIEVE BUFFER ENTRIES
value_help: ENTER A NUMBER BETWEEN 0 AND 999999
description: NUMBER OF DAYS BACK FROM TODAY TO RETRIEVE INSURANCE BUFFER ENTRY LIST.

label: DSIV BUFFER LIST COLUMN SORT
name: DSIV BUFFER LIST COLUMN SORT
description: This is the user preference for setting the buffer list column sort.

label: DSIV DEFAULT APPT LOCATION
name: DSIV DEFAULT APPT LOCATION
description: LOCATION TEXT DEFAULT WHEN DISPLAYING APPOINTMENTS LIST.

label: DSIV DEFAULT DOC TYPE
name: DSIV DEFAULT DOC TYPE
description: THIS IS THE DEFAULT DOCUMENT TYPE USED FOR FILING INSURANCE CARD IMAGES TO VISTA IMAGING

label: DSIV ENABLE AUDIT
name: DSIV ENABLE AUDIT
description: ENABLES/DISABLES AUDITING OF ADD, UPDATE, DELETE, ACCEPT, AND REJECT PROCESSES TO FILE #19625.

label: DSIV FORCE UPPERCASE
name: DSIV FORCE UPPERCASE
description: FORCE KEYBOARD TO UPPERCASE WHEN ENTERING DATA IN THE EDIT FIELDS.

label: DSIV ICB SCREEN MODE
name: DSIV ICB SCREEN MODE
description: Display mode for ICB screen.

label: DSIV IMAGE STORAGE
name: DSIV IMAGE STORAGE
display_text: STORAGE TYPE FOR INSURANCE CARD IMAGES
value_help: Network path where the insurance card images are stored
description: THIS IS THE STORAGE LOCATION FOR THE INSURANCE CARD IMAGES

label: DSIV INDEX OPTION
name: DSIV INDEX OPTION
value_help: Image filing index option value (see documentation)
description: CARD IMAGE FILING OPTION.

label: DSIV LOCAL EXCEL EXPORT
name: DSIV LOCAL EXCEL EXPORT
description: THIS INSTRUCTS THE ICB GUI TO USE THE LOCALLY INSTALLED EXCELINTERFACE TO EXPORT THE BUFFER LIST AND PATIENT UPDATE LIST.

label: DSIV MAX NUM ENTRIES
name: DSIV MAX NUM ENTRIES
description: Contains the maximum number of records to return from the buffer in one rpc call.  If there are more than the max records, then multiplay rpc calls need to be made.

label: DSIV OCR THRESHHOLD
name: DSIV OCR THRESHHOLD
value_help: Default value = .7, the lower the value, the less sensitive is the OCR
description: OCR ACCURACY THRESHHOLD. FOR EXAMPLE, 0.7.

label: DSIV PAGE SETUP
name: DSIV PAGE SETUP
description: THIS IS A MULTI-INSTANCE PARAMETER TO CONFIGURE PAGE PRINT SETUP (PER USER).

label: DSIV REQUIRED EDIT COLOR
name: DSIV REQUIRED EDIT COLOR
value_help: Standard Windows color value, default is white = 16777215
description: BACK COLOR FOR REQUIRED EDIT FIELDS.

label: DSIV REQUIRED EDIT FIELDS
name: DSIV REQUIRED EDIT FIELDS
display_text: LIST OF REQUIRED ICB EDIT FIELDS
description: THIS IS A MULTI-INSTANCED LIST OF THE ICB EDIT FORM COMPONENTS WHICH THESUPERVISOR CAN SET AS REQUIRED FIELDS.

label: DSIV SOURCE DEFAULT
name: DSIV SOURCE DEFAULT
value_help: Default source of information value for the VistA Insurance Buffer file
description: DEFAULT SOURCE WHEN AUTOMATICALLY ENTERING BUFFER ENTRIES.

label: DSIV USE SSN IN POLICY TAB
name: DSIV USE SSN IN POLICY TAB
display_text: ICB USE SSN FIELD IN POLICY TAB
description: This parameter determines if the ICB system will enable or disable the SSN field value display in the policy.  0=No, 1=Yes.

label: DSIV USER BUFFER FILTER
name: DSIV USER BUFFER FILTER
description: Save the users buffer list filter string.

label: DSIV USER DEFAULT LOCATIONS
name: DSIV USER DEFAULT LOCATIONS
description: LIST OF PREFERRED LOCATIONS TO RETRIEVE APPOINTMENTS LIST.

label: DSIV VALIDATE EXPIRE DATE
name: DSIV VALIDATE EXPIRE DATE
description: This parameter determines if the insurance validation logic will check the patient policy exire date field.  0=No, 1=Yes.

label: DSIV VER DAYS BACK
name: DSIV VER DAYS BACK
value_help: Insurance must be verified if it has not been verified in T-#days

label: DSIV VER DAYS BACK SPECIFIC
name: DSIV VER DAYS BACK SPECIFIC
description: This parameter contains a special days back value and a list of insurance companies that should use that value when checking to see if an insurance needs to be verified.

label: DSIV CV EMAIL
name: DSIV CV EMAIL
description: PARAMETER SETTING FOR SENDING VISTA EMAIL NOTIFICATION WHEN CV STATUS CHANGES.

label: DSIV REQUIRE REJECT REASON
name: DSIV REQUIRE REJECT REASON
description: Flag REASON if a Buffer entry is rejected.

label: DSIV AUDIT REPORT USERS
name: DSIV AUDIT REPORT USERS
description: Contains a list of users allowed to run ICB reports.

label: DSIV REQUIRE SCAN CARD
name: DSIV REQUIRE SCAN CARD
description: Indicates (Y/N) whether a buffer entry can be created by entry clerks from an existing patient policy.

label: DSIV USER APPT DATE RANGE
name: DSIV USER APPT DATE RANGE
description: User configured appointment list date range.

label: DSIV VER NO INSURANCE
name: DSIV VER NO INSURANCE
display_text: DAYS BACK TO VERIFY NO INSURANCE
value_help: No insurance must be verified if within T-# days
description: Contains the number of days back to check if a patient flagged as "no insurance" is still "no insurance" or now has coverage.

label: DSIV EXCEPTION PAT COUNTING
name: DSIV EXCEPTION PAT COUNTING
display_text: Count Patients on the Exception Rpt
description: If the parameter = Yes, then the Exception Report will contain only 1 patient per day.  If the parameter = No, then the Exception Report will count clerks (or appts) and could have the same patient on the report multiple times for different clinics (appts).

label: DSIV ICB ADMIN TOOLS ACCESS
name: DSIV ICB ADMIN TOOLS ACCESS
description: ICB ADMIN TOOLS ACCESS CONTROL FOR ADMIN ROLE.

label: EC LAST LOCATION
name: EC LAST LOCATION
value_help: Enter last location used by the user.

label: EC LAST CLINIC
name: EC LAST CLINIC
value_help: Enter last clinic used by the user

label: EC LAST PRINTER
name: EC LAST PRINTER
value_help: Enter last printer used by the user

label: ECOB CONSTRUCTOR
name: ECOB CONSTRUCTOR
value_help: Enter "<Tag>.<Routine>(NAME)" of constructor API

label: ECOB DESTRUCTOR
name: ECOB DESTRUCTOR
value_help: Enter "<Tag>.<Routine>(HANDLE)" of destructor API

label: ECOB METHOD
name: ECOB METHOD
value_help: Enter "<Tag>.<Routine>(.RESULT,ARGUMENT)" of method API

label: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 1
name: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 1
value_help: Answer must be 1-50 characters in length.
description: This is the first line of the Anticoagulation Clinic address.

label: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 2
name: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 2
value_help: Answer must be 1-30 characters in length.
description: This is the second line of the Anticoagulation Clinic address.

label: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 3
name: ORAM ADDRESS LINE 3
value_help: Answer must be 1-60 characters in length.
description: This is the (optional) third line of the Anticoagulation Clinic address.

label: ORAM DISCHARGE NOTE
name: ORAM DISCHARGE NOTE
value_help: Select the TIU Document Title for the Discharge Note.
description: This is the TIU Document Title that identifies the AnticoagulationDischarge Note, which is entered upon the patient's discharge from theAnticoagulation clinic.

label: ORAM INTERIM NOTE
name: ORAM INTERIM NOTE
value_help: Select the TIU Document Title for the Interim Note.
description: This is the TIU Document Title that identifies the Anticoagulation InterimNote, which is entered during the patient's ongoing treatment by theAnticoagulation clinic.

label: ORAM INITIAL NOTE
name: ORAM INITIAL NOTE
value_help: Select the TIU Document Title for the Initial Assessment Note.
description: This is the TIU Document Title that identifies the Anticoagulation InitialAssessment Note, which is entered for the patient's first visit uponenrollment in the Clinic.

label: ORAM TEAM LIST (ALL)
name: ORAM TEAM LIST (ALL)
value_help: Select the Patient Team List for ALL Anticoagulation patients.
description: The ALL Patient list, shows everyone scheduled for that team for that dayAND any patients NOT completed on previous days.                                 Patients drop off this list as they are completed in the Anticoagulator.

label: ORAM TEAM LIST (COMPLEX)
name: ORAM TEAM LIST (COMPLEX)
value_help: Select the Patient Team List for incomplete Anticoagulation patients.
description: The complex patient list pulls out these patients so that they are notlost on the larger list (they appear on both lists).                                 Patients drop off this list as they are completed in the Anticoagulator.

label: ORAM CLINIC FAX NUMBER
name: ORAM CLINIC FAX NUMBER
value_help: Enter the phone number of the clinic (e.g., (###)###-####x####)
description: Telephone number, with extension if needed, for FAXes to be sent to theanticoagulation clinic. For patient letters.

label: ORAM CLINIC PHONE NUMBER
name: ORAM CLINIC PHONE NUMBER
value_help: Enter the phone number of the clinic (e.g., (###)###-####x####)
description: Telephone number, with extension if needed, for patient to contact theanticoagulation clinic. For patient letters.

label: ORAM CONSULT LINK ENABLED
name: ORAM CONSULT LINK ENABLED
value_help: Indicate whether or not the Consult Linkage should be enabled.
description: Indicates if Consult Linker will be used. If NO: prompt will not be seento complete consult.

label: ORAM CONSULT REQUEST SERVICE
name: ORAM CONSULT REQUEST SERVICE
value_help: Select the Consult Request Service for the Anticoagulation Clinic.
description: This is the reference to the Consult Request Service with which Consultdata will be associated for the Anticoagulation clinic. It is used only ifthe linkage with the Consult Package is enabled.

label: ORAM CPT FOR COMPLEX PHONE
name: ORAM CPT FOR COMPLEX PHONE
value_help: Enter the current CPT code for a Complex Telephone Visit.
description: This is the CPT code for a Complex Telephone Visit (i.e., HC PRO PHONECALL 21-30 MIN (CPT-4 98968), as of 10/2008).

label: ORAM CPT FOR INITIAL VISIT
name: ORAM CPT FOR INITIAL VISIT
value_help: Enter the CPT code for the Initial Office Visit
description: This is the CPT code for the Initial Office Visit (i.e., ANTICOAG MGMT, INIT (CPT-4 99363), as of 10/2008).

label: ORAM CPT FOR LETTER TO PT
name: ORAM CPT FOR LETTER TO PT
value_help: Enter the CPT code for Letter to patient.
description: This is the CPT code for a Letter to the Patient (i.e., (CPT-4 98966), asof 10/2008).

label: ORAM CPT FOR ORIENTATION
name: ORAM CPT FOR ORIENTATION
value_help: This is the current CPT code for the Orientation Class Visit.
description: This is the CPT code for the Orientation Class Visit (i.e., GROUP HEALTH EDUCATION (CPT-4 99078), as of 10/2008).

label: ORAM CPT FOR SIMPLE PHONE
name: ORAM CPT FOR SIMPLE PHONE
value_help: Current CPT code for a Simple Telephone Visit.
description: This is the CPT code for a Simple Telephone Visit (i.e., HC PRO PHONE CALL5-10 MIN (CPT-4 98966), as of 10/2008).

label: ORAM CPT FOR SUBSEQUENT VISIT
name: ORAM CPT FOR SUBSEQUENT VISIT
value_help: Enter the CPT code for a Subsequent Office Visit.
description: This is the CPT code for Subsequent Anticoagulation Management (i.e.,ANTICOAG MGMT, SUBSEQ (CPT-4 99364), as of 10/2008).

label: ORAM INR QUICK ORDER
name: ORAM INR QUICK ORDER
value_help: Select the Quick Order for INR.
description: This is the reference to the Quick Order Dialog for the INR (InternationalNormalized Ratio) for Prothrombin Times.                                 INR: International normalized ratio, a system established by the WorldHealth Organization (WHO) and the International Committee on Thrombosisand Hemostasis for reporting the results of blood coagulation (clotting)tests. All results are standardized using the international sensitivityindex for the particular thromboplastin reagent and instrument combinationutilized to perform the test.                                 For example, a person taking the anticoagulant ("blood thinner") warfarin(brand name: Coumadin) might optimally maintain a prothrombin time (a "protime" or PT) of 2 to 3 INR. No matter what laboratory checks theprothrombin time, the result should be the same even if differentthromboplastins and instruments are used. This internationalstandardization permits the patient on warfarin to travel and still obtaincomparable test results.

label: ORAM CBC QUICK ORDER
name: ORAM CBC QUICK ORDER
value_help: Choose the Quick Order for CBC.
description: This is the reference to the Quick Order Dialog for Complete Blood Count(CBC).

description: These are the Indications for care and their associated ICD-9-CM codes.

label: ORAM AUTO PRIMARY INDICATION
name: ORAM AUTO PRIMARY INDICATION
value_help: Enter the current ICD-9-CM code for the Indication.
description: This is an Indication for care which will automatically be filed as the Primary Indication for each visit to the applicable Clinic. (e.g., if all visits to a non-licensed provider should be filed with V58.61 L/T (CURRENT) USE - ANTICOAG as the primary indication, you canspecify that with this parameter. If all visits should also have V58.83 ENCTR THERAP DRUG MONITOR as an automatic Secondary Indication for care, you can express that by setting the Auto Secondary Indic for Care (ICD-9-CM) parameter. The user will still be able to select additional indication(s) from the list).

label: ORAM APPT MATCH LOOK-BACK
name: ORAM APPT MATCH LOOK-BACK
value_help: This is the inclusive lower limit (0-7 days) for appointment matching.
description: This is the whole number of days to look-back when attempting to match theAnticoagulation Encounter to a scheduled appointment in the VistA Scheduling Package. Please enter a number between 0 and 7, no decimal digits. The default will be one (1) day (i.e., yesterday). A value of zero (0)will restrict the search to begin with today's appointments (i.e.,T@00:00).

label: ORAM APPT MATCH LOOK-AHEAD
name: ORAM APPT MATCH LOOK-AHEAD
value_help: This is the inclusive upper limit (0-3 days) for appointment matching.

Please enter a number between 0 and 3, no decimal digits. The default will be one (1) day (i.e., tomorrow). A value of zero (0) willrestrict the search to end with today's appointments (i.e., T@23:59).

label: TIU USER CLASS FOR VBC
name: TIU USER CLASS FOR VBC
display_text: User Class for VBC Line Counts
value_term: User Class for VBC Line Counts
value_help: Select the Class of Users for whom VBC Line counts will be reported.
description: This parameter identifies the User Class whose members should have VisibleBlack Character Line Counts reported for the TIU documents which they enter (e.g., Contract Transcriptionists). If defined, the TIU Billing Verification Report will include documentsentered by members of this class. If left undefined, the TIU BillingVerification Report will include any document entered by a person who isneither the author or expected cosigner (which could include in-housetranscriptionists, secretaries, technicians, or students, who"ghost-write" documents on behalf of licensed providers, who in turn mustreview/sign the content). If you discover that the Billing Verification Report at your station includes an unacceptable number of documents entered by users whose workshould not be included in the report, you can "filter the noise" by identifying a User Class using this parameter, and making sure that only the people whose work should be reported are added as members to that User Class.

label: EDPF LOCATION
name: EDPF LOCATION
value_help: Enter a HOSPITAL LOCATION used by the Emergency Department.
instance_help: Enter a time range (like 0800-1200) or a sequential number.
description: This parameter lists the entry or entries from the Hospital Location file (#44) that are used by the Emergency Department.  If there are multiple Hospital Location file entries for the Emergency Department there are two choices when prompted for "Time Range or Sequence": Time Range allows you to map Hospital Location entries by time of day.  When creating an encounter in PCE, EDIS will match the Hospital Location based on the current time of day.  You may enter the time range in military time.  For example, 0800-1600 or 1800-2400 would be two possible time range entries. Sequence allows you to map Hospital Location entries in a preferred order.  When creating an encounter in PCE, EDIS will use the entry with the lowest sequence number to create the visit. When creating the encounter by using the scheduling package to check-in, any matches to the list (whether time range or sequence based) will cause the checked-in patient to be added to the display board.

Other options include:   1:  Allow only persons holding the ORELSE key.  2:  Allow only persons holding the PSJ RNURSE key.  3:  Allow selection from all entries in the NEW PERSON file (200).

label: OR VBECS AVAIL UNITS FORMAT
name: OR VBECS AVAIL UNITS FORMAT
value_help: 0=Horizontal, 1=Vertical, 2=Split Horizontal
description: This parameter determines the format that Available Units is displayedon the Blood Bank Report and the Patient Information screen on theBlood Bank Order Dialog. 0:HORIZONTAL - Displays fields across the page, one line per date/time.                Printed reports splits line if longer than 79 characters. 1:VERTICAL   - Displays fields down the page in sections per date/time.              - Printed report looks the same. 2:SPLIT HORIZONTAL -    Patient Information Screen - Same as HORIZONTAL format   Report - Splits line in 2 if longer than 79 characters.   Printed Report - Splits line in 2 if longer than 79 characters. This parameter was created to address issues found when printingthe Blood Bank report in the horizontal format. The option of displaying/printing Available units vertically has been created. As more fields are added to this portion of the report withvariable lengths, the length of the line may go beyond the 80character limit for printing. This is not as big of an issue inthe Windows display. The Patient Information Screen cannot be printed, so no attempt has been made to split the line when itgoes beyond 79 characters. It functions the same when eitherHORIZONTAL or SPLIT HORIZONTAL is selected. For both HORIZONTAL display formats the length of the line expands or contracts depending on the column width of each fieldand the length of the longest line. Because of this it ispossible, though not likely, that the line will not split evenif SPLIT HORIZONTAL is selected.

The BP will delete the file if told to do so whether or not it successfully imports the image.  The usual exception to this occurs when the BP process does not have RWD rights to the folder where the image resides.

label: LA LEDI ORU HL7 STATUS
name: LA LEDI ORU HL7 STATUS
instance_term: LEDI Result Messaging Status For Agency
value_help: Specify the areas of Laboratory which LEDI supports.
description: This parameter is used to control the building of LEDI HL7 result messageson an interface basis for specific messaging partners based on the AGENCYassociated with the interface. It allows for the selectiveenabling/disabling of either all result messaging or just result messagingin support of specific areas of VistA Laboratory. It currently allows for control of the main laboratory areas, also referred to as subscripts or a combination. The areas are: 'CH' = laboratory tests within the "CH" subscript of LAB DATA file (#63). 'MI' = laboratory tests within the "MI" subscript of LAB DATA file (#63). 'AP' = laboratory tests within the "SP", "CY", and "EM" subscript of LAB        DATA file (#63). Selecting "Disabled" disables all sections of laboratory.Selecting "Enabled" enables all three main sections ("CH", "MI", and "AP")

label: LA LEDI ORM HL7 STATUS
name: LA LEDI ORM HL7 STATUS
instance_term: LEDI Order Messaging Status For Agency
value_help: Specify the areas of Laboratory which LEDI supports.
description: This parameter is used to control the building of LEDI HL7 order messageson an interface basis for specific messaging partners based on the AGENCYassociated with the interface. It allows for the selectiveenabling/disabling of either all order messaging or just order messagingin support of specific areas of VistA Laboratory. It currently allows for control of the main laboratory areas, also referred to as subscripts or a combination. The areas are: 'CH' = laboratory tests within the "CH" subscript of LAB DATA file (#63). 'MI' = laboratory tests within the "MI" subscript of LAB DATA file (#63). 'AP' = laboratory tests within the "SP", "CY", and "EM" subscript of LAB        DATA file (#63). Selecting "Disabled" disables all sections of laboratory.Selecting "Enabled" enables all three main sections ("CH", "MI", and "AP")

label: OR DEA TEXT

value_term: DEA MSG TO SHOW ON SIG DIALOG

description: This parameter allows sites to set what exactly they would like the message to be that is shown on the signature dialog when a controlled substance item is checked to be included in signing.  This text is mandated by the DEA.

label: ORQQPL SUPPRESS CODES
name: ORQQPL SUPPRESS CODES
display_text: Suppress Codes in Lexicon Problem Search
value_help: Indicate whether code values should be hidden during Problem searches.
description: This parameter determines whether the user will be shown SNOMED CT and ICD codes when searching for patient problems.

label: ORCDGMRC EARLIEST DATE DEFAULT
name: ORCDGMRC EARLIEST DATE DEFAULT
value_help: Enter default relative date (e.g. T+30D, T+2W, T+1M), no time or past dates.
description: This defines the default date value for the Earliest Appropriate Date (EAD) field in consult and procedure orders.  This date value can be TODAYor greater and must be a relative date (e.g. "TODAY", T+7D, "T+2W").Past dates and precise dates are not permitted.  The date value may also be a null/empty date, which is set by deleting (via XPAR MENU TOOLS) thecurrent value for the parameter (if one is set). Any new orders in CPRS GUI and new quick orders will default to the parameter value.  Any quick orders that currently have a default value for the EAD will retain that value.  If that quick order should reflect the parameter value, simply remove the current default value for the quick order and save the change.  The quick order would then defaultto the parameter value.

label: OR PROBLEM NTRT BY DIVISION
name: OR PROBLEM NTRT BY DIVISION
value_help: Enter the local mail group for the recipients for this Division.
description: This parameter allows the routing of the OR PROBLEM LIST NTRT BULLETINS (for novel terms which local users are requesting extensions to the SNOMED CT standard). By default members of the OR CACS mailgroup will receive all Problem List NTRT bulletins. This parameter allows routing of requests to mailgroups specific to the division identified by the requestor at log-in.

Information about contacting an administrative personnel should be included here if they are still unable to prescribe controlled substance orders and believe they should have that ability.

label: LR AP DEFAULT ACCESSION NUMBER
name: LR AP DEFAULT ACCESSION NUMBER
display_text: Method of Assigning AP Accession Number
value_help: Select the method the system will use to assign a default accession number.
description: When an Anatomic Pathology (AP) case is accessioned, this parameter will control how the system should assign a default accession number to the case being logged in. (Note: The user will still be able to override the default, and select a different accession number, if they so choose). 'First Available Number' - The system will start searching from number one, and the first available accession number that is found in thataccession area will be used as the default accession number for the newcase being logged in. Choosing this method will minimize the likelihood ofhaving any gaps in the accession numbering, however, there is thepossibility that some accessions might be out of sequence. 'Next Available Sequential Number' - The system will start searching from the last accession number that was logged in, and the next available number that is found in that accession area will be used as the default accession number for the new case being logged in. Choosing this method should better keep the accession numbers in sequence, but there is the possibility that some gaps in the numbering might be introduced. If no selection is made, the system will default to 'First Available Number'.

label: LRJ HL LAST START DATE
name: LRJ HL LAST START DATE
value_help: This was the start date used when the TaskMan HL Change Report last completed.
description: This field indicates the start date used when the Hospital Location Change Report messages were previously generated by TaskMan. The purpose of this data is to record the previous start date for the report generated by the TaskMan job.

label: LRJ HL LAST END DATE
name: LRJ HL LAST END DATE
value_help: This was the end date used when the TaskMan HL Change Report last completed.
description: This field indicates the end date used when the Hospital Location Change Report messages were previously generated by TaskMan. The purpose of this data is to record the previous end date for the report generated by the TaskMan job.  It is used to prevent the TaskManjob from reporting a Hospital Location change or addition more than onceand differently than was previously reported. label: ORAM I10 INDICATIONS FOR CARE

(e.g., if all visits to a non-licensed provider should be filed with Z79.01 Long term (current) use of anticoagulants , you can specify thatwith this parameter. If all visits should also have Z51.81 Encounter for therapeutic drug level monitoring as an automatic Secondary Indication forcare, you can express that by setting the Auto Secondary Indic for Care(ICD-10-CM) parameter. The user will still be able to select additionalindication(s) from the list).

label: ORAM AUTO SECONDARY INDICATION

(e.g., if all visits to a non-licensed provider should be filed with V58.83 ENCTR THERAP DRUG MONITOR as the first secondary indication, youcan specify that with this parameter, and the user will still be able toselect additional secondary indication(s) from the list).

label: DSIV NON-ICB INDEX

For example, DRM Plus canlaunch MiPACS to view dental radiographs, and iMedConsent to get requiredconsent forms.

Placing any value in this parameter has the effect of disabling the AMIS290 for the Regional Office [DVBA C RO AMIS 290] and AMIS 290 Report forC&P [DVBA C AMIS REPORT] options in VistA, the corresponding AMIS 290 andAMIS 290 by Division reports on the CAPRI Reports dialog box, and the AMIS290 report on the Consolidated Remote Reports dialog box in the CAPRI GUIapplication.

label: HMP PARAMETERS

description: This parameter stores a list of parameters used by the HMP middle teir and the HMP UI.whenever the schema changes in a way that requires a conversion or re-extraction of objects.  The fractional piece increments whenever the schema is extended.

description: This contains the version number of the HMP schema which describes theJSON objects produced by the HMP extracts.  The whole number incrementswhenever the schema changes in a way that requires a conversion orre-extraction of objects.  The fractional piece increments whenever theschema is extended.

label: HMP LOCATIONS
name: HMP LOCATIONS
instance_help: Enter clinic to synch with HMP

label: HMP TASK WAIT TIME
name: HMP TASK WAIT TIME

description: This is the number of seconds that the system will wait before re-queuingthe HMP Data Monitor background job.

label: HMP DOMAIN SIZES
name: HMP DOMAIN SIZES
value_help: Enter the average size in bytes for each domain item.
instance_help: Enter the internal name for the domain (3rd UID piece).
description: This parameter contains a list of VPR extract domains and their average sizes.  The sizes are used in computing the approximate size of an item with limiting the freshness calls by size.

label: HMP EXTRACT DISK SIZE LIMIT
name: HMP EXTRACT DISK SIZE LIMIT
value_help: Enter the # of megabytes of data that triggers a requeue (10-2000)
description: Maximum size (megabytes) of all VPR extracts in ^XTMP("VPRFX~*") waiting to be sent to HMP servers as part of getPtUpdates.  If maximum is reached, patient domain extract TasKman jobs will be requeued to a future time, as specified in the VPR EXTRACT TASK REQUEUE SECS parameter. At that time, this maximum check will be performed again.  Also, this maximum check occurs when an executing extract job is about to start another domain extract. If maximum size has been reached, the job will hang the number of seconds specified by the VPR EXTRACT TASK REQUEUE SECS parameter. The maximum check will occur again after the hang time has expired.  This limit is needed to insure the ^XTMP global does not get too big during initial/resync domain extract processing and cause disk full  errors.

label: HMP EXTRACT TASK REQUEUE SECS
name: HMP EXTRACT TASK REQUEUE SECS
display_text: seconds to requeue task or hang job
value_help: Enter 5 to 60 seconds
description: When extract task cannot be run because of possible ^XTMP disk concerns, this parameter is used to requeue the task to a future date/time or hang an extract job currently executing.  ^XTMP disk space frees up as other already generated extracts are sent to the various HMP servers.  Allowed Values:  5 to 60     (5 seconds to 1 minute)         Default: 10           (if parameter not set)    Initialized: 10           (set in post-init during first install)

label: LA UI PROVIDER CONTACT INFO
name: LA UI PROVIDER CONTACT INFO
value_help: Specify which method to use to contact the ordering provider.
instance_help: Enter the sequence for the contact info.
description: Contains the list of which contact info for the ordering provider to send in a Lab HL7 Order message from the user's corresponding entry in NEW PERSON file (#200). It can be specified at the system or the individual user level. Ifspecified at the user level it takes precedence and overrides the settingat the system level allowing specific users to have their own specific setof contacts to send. The sequence specifies the order and info to check, maximum of 6 allowed.Only the first 2 with a value will be placed in the message as the HL7standard constrains the number of repetitions for this information at 2. The value specifies which field from the person's entry in NEW PERSON file (#200) to send in the message. These are the fields currently available. Field #   Field Name       Description .131      PHONE (HOME)     This is the telephone number for the new                           person. .132      OFFICE PHONE     This is the business/office telephone for the                           new person. .133      PHONE #3         This is an alternate telephone number where the                           new person might also be reached.   .134      PHONE #4         This is another alternate telephone number                           where the new person might also be reached. .135     COMMERCIAL PHONE  This is a commercial phone number. .136     FAX NUMBER        This field holds a phone number for a FAX                            machine for this user. It needs to be a format                           that can be understood by a sending MODEM. .137      VOICE PAGER      This field holds a phone number for an ANALOG                           PAGER that this person carries with them. .138      DIGITAL PAGER    This field holds a phone number for a DIGITAL                           PAGER that this person carries with them.  The parameter is distributed pre-configured at the package level as follows:  Sequence  Value --------  ----- 1         OFFICE PHONE 2         DIGITAL PAGER 3         VOICE PAGER 4         PHONE #3 5         PHONE #4 6         PHONE (HOME) 7         COMMERICAL PHONE 8         FAX NUMBER

To restrict template use by USER CLASS,use the TIU TEMPLATE ACCESS BY CLASS parameter.  These two parameters work together, in the following precedence order: Precedence  Parameter----------  ----------------------------USER        TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSUSER CLASS  TIU TEMPLATE ACCESS BY CLASSLOCATION    TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSSERVICE     TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSDIVISION    TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSSYSTEM      TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESS

These two parameters work together, in the following precedence order: Precedence  Parameter----------  ----------------------------USER        TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSUSER CLASS  TIU TEMPLATE ACCESS BY CLASSLOCATION    TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSSERVICE     TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSDIVISION    TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESSSYSTEM      TIU PERSONAL TEMPLATE ACCESS

label: ORB OI ORDERED - OUTPT
name: ORB OI ORDERED - OUTPT
display_text: Flag Items to Send OUTPT ORDER Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is ordered for an outpatient. If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alertrecipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potentialalert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a deviceis added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive thealert.) Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attendingphysician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner,PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient'sPCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient.OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (Ifa patient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users onthat team become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.)are linked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RRteam.

label: ORB OI RESULTS - OUTPT
name: ORB OI RESULTS - OUTPT
display_text: Flag Item to Send OUTPT RESULT Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification when resulted.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is resulted for an outpatient. Results only apply to orderswhich can be resulted (lab, imaging, consults.) If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alertrecipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potentialalert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a deviceis added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive thealert.)      Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attendingphysician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner,PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient'sPCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient.OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (Ifa patient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users onthat team become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.)are linked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RRteam.

label: PXRM GUI REMINDERS ACTIVE
name: PXRM GUI REMINDERS ACTIVE
value_help: Are Interactive Reminders Active (0=No, 1=Yes)
description: Indicate if Interactive Reminders are Active.  Enter 0 (No) or 1 (Yes).

label: ORM ORMTIME LAST RUN
name: ORM ORMTIME LAST RUN
description: This parameter is written and accessed by ORMTIME and related processing.No direct user access is intended.

label: PSB DEFAULT BARCODE PREFIX

label: OR PRINT ALL ORDERS CHART SUM
name: OR PRINT ALL ORDERS CHART SUM
display_text: Print All orders on Chart Summary
value_term: PRINT ALL ORDERS ON CHART SUMMARY
value_help: 0=previously printed, 1=All, 2=depends on Nature of Order
description: A value of 1 in this parameter will print all orders on the 24 Hourchart summary report options. A value of 0 will only print orders that originally printed a  chartcopy.  This is the default value for this parameter.  Some sites havehad problems with this value, because the Chart Copy Summary may bedifferent from the Order Summary report, which prints all orders.Some orders don't print a chart copy automatically, because of thenature of order the order was given when entered, or because the locationfrom which the order was entered, may not have been setup for printing. A value of 2 will look at the Nature of Order file to determine if theorder should print on the summary report.

This may also be set to listonly those orders placed during the current session, or all unsigned ordersfor this patient regardless of provider.

label: ORWPCE ASK ENCOUNTER UPDATE

value_help: Ask for Encounter update when these conditions are met.
description: When signing a note in the CPRS GUI, this parameter is used to determineunder what conditions to request the user enter encounter information.Note that encounter data is never required for inpatients.0 = User is the Primary Encounter Provider, and Encounter Data is Needed1 = User is the Primary Encounter Provider, and Patient is an Outpatient2 = User is the Primary Encounter Provider3 = Encounter Data is Needed4 = Patient is an Outpatient5 = Always6 = Never7 = Disable - Same as Never but disables the Encounter button

label: ORWOR AUTOSAVE NOTE
name: ORWOR AUTOSAVE NOTE
value_help: Enter the interval (in seconds) that notes should be auto-saved.
description: This parameter determines how many seconds should elapse between eachauto-save of a note that is being edited in the GUI.

label: ORCH INITIAL TAB
name: ORCH INITIAL TAB
value_help: Enter the tab that CPRS should open to when it first starts.
description: This parameter identifies the tab that should be initially displayed whenCPRS first starts.  If ORCH USE LAST TAB is 'no', this tab is also usedwhenever a new patient is selected.

label: ORCH USE LAST TAB
name: ORCH USE LAST TAB
display_text: Use Last Selected Tab on Patient Change
value_help: Enter Yes if CPRS should open to the last selected tab when changing patients.
description: When this parameter is set to yes, CPRS will open to the last selected tabwhenever changing patients.  When set to no, CPRS will open to the tabidentified by ORCH INITIAL TAB.

label: PXRM MENTAL HEALTH ACTIVE
name: PXRM MENTAL HEALTH ACTIVE
value_help: Are Interactive Mental Health Reminders Active (0=No, 1=Yes)
description: Interactive Mental Health Reminders are Active.  Enter 0 (No) or 1 (Yes).

label: ORWOR DISABLE WEB ACCESS
name: ORWOR DISABLE WEB ACCESS
value_help: Enter yes to disable web links
description: When this parameter is set to yes, web links in the CPRS GUI will bedisabled or hidden.

label: OR ORDER SUMMARY CONTEXT
name: OR ORDER SUMMARY CONTEXT
value_help: 0=based on order date, 1=based on start date, 2=start date plus any activity
description: A value of 0 will print all orders with ORDER dates within the selected date range. A value of 1 will print all orders with START dates within the selecteddate range. A value of 2 will print all orders with START dates and orders with anyACTIVITY within the selected date range.

label: ORWOR VERIFY NOTE TITLE
name: ORWOR VERIFY NOTE TITLE
value_help: Enter NO to allow the default note title to load without verification.
description: If this parameter is set to YES, the window that allows the user to changea note title will appear whenever the user starts to enter a new note,even if they have a default title.  If the parameter is set to NO, -and-the user has a default title, that title will be automatically loaded whena new note is entered.

label: ORWCH FONT SIZE
name: ORWCH FONT SIZE
value_help: Enter the preferred font size (in points).
description: This saves the preferred font size for CPRS Chart.

label: ORK EDITABLE BY USER
name: ORK EDITABLE BY USER
display_text: Order Check On/Off Editable by User
value_help: Enter 'yes' if the order check can be "Enabled" or "Disabled" by users.
description: System and Division indicate if the order check can be edited bya user.  Valid values include "Yes" and "No".  If the value is "Yes", theorder check can be "Enabled" or "Disabled" by a user.  Users do haveaccess to change the order check's ORK PROCESSING FLAG parameter value.If the value is "No", the order check CANNOT be "Enabled" or "Disabled" bya user. Users do NOT have access to change the order check's ORKPROCESSING FLAG parameter value.

label: ORB OI EXPIRING - INPT
name: ORB OI EXPIRING - INPT
display_text: Flag Item to Send INPT EXPIRING Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification when expiring.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specificorderable item is expiring for an inpatient.   If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user,team, device) flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alertrecipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user,team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potentialalert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a deviceis added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive thealert.) Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attendingphysician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner,PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient'sPCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient.OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (Ifa patient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users onthat team become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.)are linked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RRteam.

label: ORB OI EXPIRING - OUTPT
name: ORB OI EXPIRING - OUTPT
display_text: Flag Item to Send OUTPT EXPIRING Notifs
value_help: Enter 'Yes' to trigger an alert for ALL patients, 'No' for only linked patients.
instance_help: Enter the orderable item to trigger a notification when expiring.
description: This parameter is used to trigger a notification/alert when a specific orderable item is expiring for an outpatient.     If the value for the orderable item flag is "YES", the entity (user, team, device) flagging the orderable item becomes a potential alert recipient for ALL patients.  If the value is "NO", the entity (user, team, device), flagging the orderable item only becomes a potential alert recipient if that entity is "linked" to the patient.  (If a device is added to the potential recipient list, it will always receive the alert.)   Users are linked to a patient if the user is the patient's attending physician, primary inpatient provider, PCMM primary care practitioner, PCMM associate provider, user is assigned to a position on the patient's PCMM primary care team or user shares an OE/RR team with the patient. OE/RR teams are linked to a patient if the patient is on the team. (If a patient is on a team that has flagged an orderable item, all users on  that team become potential alert recipients.)  Devices (printers, etc.) are linked to a patient if the device and patient are on the same OE/RR team.
